Title: Marketing Director
Job_Description:
CREATIVE DESIGNER WITH MARKETING IMPLEMENTATION AND ANALYTICS EXPERIENCE
International CSO (Chief Sales Officer) 2GO is an innovative multi-functional sales and marketing agency.
Our vision is to increase joy in the world!
Our mission is to create and implement sales and marketing strategies aligned to the values of our clients and exceed return expectations.
Salary = $60,000, First Year OTE = $80,000
Our three Core Business Units:

Title: Marketing Director
Job_Description:
You may not realize it, but you’ve likely used a product today made possible by the plastics and chemicals manufactured by Chevron Phillips Chemical. From medical supplies and electronics to food packaging and cosmetics, we create the building blocks for more than 70,000 consumer and industrial products.

Even as a global company with 5,000 employees, we maintain a “small company feel” and uphold a culture of respect, diversity, and inclusion. Ask any Chevron Phillips Chemical employee what they like best about their job, and universally, the answer is “the people I work with!” We value work-life balance, and love to see our employees thrive both professionally and personally. There has never been a better time to work for Chevron Phillips Chemical. If you’re ready to grow with us and become part of our vision of being the premier Chemical Company, apply today!

Title: Marketing Director
Job_Description:
The game is changing in business payment, and FLEETCOR is leading the way with innovative solutions that streamline the payment process and help companies control spending.
The FLEETCOR team has cracked the code. We've assembled an A-team of business partners, payment networks, and employees. We have the technology and have made it our mission to develop and deliver better ways to pay.
FLEETCOR is not just about fun team events or great learning opportunities (although we have those too!). We’re growing our team and are looking for an Full Stack Developer to join us and make a real impact! If that is you, APPLY NOW!
Position Summary:
The Sr. Full Stack Developer is responsible for developing and supporting web applications that source and provide lodging, meals, and transportation for airline crew and passengers. The candidate will contribute to all aspects of internet connected application development including performance, scalability, coding, caching, security, encryption, session state management, data management, error logging, and testing. The primary skills for this position are .NET, C#, and Angular 11 / JavaScript.

Title: Marketing Director
Job_Description:
Macquarie Group is offering an exciting opportunity for a DevOps Engineer with a strong background in Java to join a diverse and innovative team that develops and maintains critical applications for our Risk Management business.
As a developer in our team, you will gain exposure to various state of the art technologies, and will also gain exposure to strategic technology initiatives including creating new applications on the Public Cloud and integrating our different systems.
This role will comprise of design, development, testing (unit & automation), implementation and maintenance of software solutions with a focus on quality and DevOps principles. You will have a diverse range of full stack development opportunities including new web services and APIs in Java, and creating new applications on the Public Cloud. In addition, you will help with production support, including coordinating the resolution of high severity incidents.

Title: Marketing Director
Job_Description:
As a backend software engineer, you will be responsible for building and owning one of the many critical services on our client's platform.
Create new developments to our client's platform
Accountable for delivery, deployment, maintenance, and monitoring the performance of your applications and the platform as a whole
Evaluate tools, technologies, frameworks, and vendors for the platform
Write performant and concise code to meet the defined standards at our client, review the code of peers, and ensure security and scalability of the features you work on
Create the backlog of tech debt and features, suggesting areas for improvement and enhancement

Title: Marketing Director
Job_Description:
Emerson Automation Solutions is looking for a talented and versatile Software Development Manager to lead multiple small teams of developers as they design, develop and maintain the award winning DeltaV Distributed Control System.
AS SOFTWARE DEVELOPMENT MANAGER, YOU WILL:
Foster high-performing scrum teams by providing coaching and feedback
Evaluate developer performance, using observation and input from the team
Participate in development of department and team processes, best practices and guidelines, and help team execute using them
Recruit and onboard capable developers, based on team and organization needs
Collaborate with Scrum Masters, Architects and Agile Release Train leadership and others to eliminate impediments and support team's continuous improvement

Title: Marketing Director
Job_Description:
Bring your strong data engineering and cloud skills to our team and work with modern technology deploying microservices to the cloud. Work directly with our business and learn about the financial services industry as you deliver technology solutions for our global asset management business.
As a Software Developer, you will deliver the software solutions which empower our people and clients to innovate and invest for a better future. Collaborating with colleagues across the globe, you’ll work with a variety of modern technologies all built on our cloud-based infrastructure.
You’ll have the satisfaction of seeing the software development process through from start to finish and the impact of your solutions as they bring opportunities to life. You will be involved from understanding the opportunity and the business case, through to prototyping requirements and delivering the final solution. You’ll design, make technology decisions, ensure security by design, code, document, test performance, and provide support. There is no aspect that you won’t be involved with.

Title: Marketing Director
Job_Description:
Core-Mark is one of the largest marketers of fresh, food, and broad-line supply solutions to the convenience retail industry in North America. Founded in 1888, Core-Mark, part of Performance Food Group’s family of companies, offers a full range of products, marketing programs, and technology solutions in the U.S. and Canada.
At Core-Mark, you will discover a culture that enables you to grow, challenges you to achieve, and embraces you as family. Show us your power and come explore your opportunities with Core-Mark.
THE POWER OF ONE. STRENGTHENED BY ALL.
Position Summary:
A core function of the IT department within Core-Mark is to develop and support our suite of IBMi(AS400) applications, primarily the custom developed Distribution Center Management System (DCMS) and related interfaces. DCMS is at the heart of the company in terms of Supply Chain, Warehouse Management, Customer Billing, Inventory, and interfaces with financial systems (SAP FICO and BW) and other custom and packaged systems.

Title: Marketing Director
Job_Description:
If you are Scrum Leader AND Senior Cloud Software Engineer looking for an opportunity to grow, Emerson has an exciting opportunity for you! Based in our Austin, Texas location, you will be the servant-leader of 1-2 agile teams within a Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe)-based organization aimed at delivering world-quality process control products built across web, cloud, PC and embedded platforms integrated with locally developed hardware. This opportunity allows you to work in a highly collaborative team environment for this start-up project.

The ideal candidate has experience contributing to an agile transformation and working in a SAFe-based organization and is passionate about working with software development team members to foster an effective Agile/Scrum environment while coordinating with other agile teams and development leaders in order to deliver great products. You should be able to work in a dynamic and fast-passed environment and communicate effectively with a wide range of people, experience levels, and technical backgrounds.

Title: Marketing Director
Job_Description:
Come be a part of the global business payments company that is disrupting the $170 trillion annual spend for supplier and employee expenses.
The game is changing in business payment, and FLEETCOR is leading the way with innovative solutions that streamline the payment process and help companies control spending.
The FLEETCOR team has cracked the code. We've assembled an A-team of business partners, payment networks, and employees. We have the technology and have made it our mission to develop and deliver better ways to pay.
Fleetcor provides opportunities for growth, in addition to work-life balance, and competitive compensation. We value fostering career paths, recognizing, and rewarding hard work! Come join a team that has flexible work schedules, and ongoing opportunities for professional development and advancement.

Title: Marketing Director
Job_Description:
Work with the latest web technologies and libraries to produce high quality, well-commented and well-tested code
Perform ongoing design and implementation of our React/Angular/NodeJS-based web applications from technical specifications and UX wireframes
Drive and contribute to application architecture discussions and decisions, aligning with industry best practices
Perform peer review code and test full feature applications
Provide mentorship for junior- and mid-level developers
Develop pro-active solutions for new projects and potential problems should they arise

Job_Description:
The Successful Software Developer will:
Utilize Java, API, Restful, SQl and NoSQL for assigned project in technology migration and app development.
Debug coding errors as presented by the Consutant Business Unit.
Develop mobile application in Android environment.
Report directly to the Director of Digital Technology Delivery.
Work within cloud environments utilizing Azure.
Collaborate with a team of less than 10 developers.
Participate in agile sprints to productively write robust code.

Title: Marketing Director
Job_Description:
The SharePoint Administrator will be responsible for:
Accountable for the SharePoint system's architecture, setup, and systems analysis. creates, improves, and tests a system.
Consults consumers to ascertain their needs, then adapts the system to fit their needs.
Evaluates system capabilities and suggests enhancements Examines, investigates, and fixes issues with data, software, servers, and usage.
Keeps track of system components including web services, databases, etc. and monitors performance.
Collaborates closely with other administrators and developers to update and develop new workflows, or to integrate SharePoint with other systems.
Monitors and improves the system's storage, security, and performance.

Title: Marketing Director
Job_Description:
Overview:
Who We Are
Warner Bros. Discovery's DTC technology and product organization sits at the intersection of tech, entertainment, and everyday utility. We are continuously leveraging new technology to build immersive and interactive viewing experiences. Our platform covers everything from search, catalog, and video transcoding, to personalization, global subscriptions, and more. We are committed to delivering quality user experiences, ranging from video streaming to applications across connected TV, mobile, web and consoles. As a pure tech organization, we are essential to Warner Bros. Discovery’s continued growth, building world-class products from the ground-up for our iconic brands like HBO Max, Discovery Channel, CNN, Food Network, HGTV, Eurosport, MotorTrend, and many more.
Who You Are

Title: Marketing Director
Job_Description:
About Your Role:
We are looking for a Java Developer Level 2 to be part of our award-winning development team. You’ll work on a team of frontend and backend developers supporting the expanding business needs of a custom, high performance web application framework. You will work in a collaborative Agile environment to fulfill feature requests from multiple business groups while supporting developers across the company leveraging the framework.

About Your Contributions:

Build, extend, and maintain a growing library of Dotdash Meredith components, data connectors, and web platform integration points.


Pay Range: $117,000 to $141,000

Title: Marketing Director
Job_Description:
There are over 7 billion people on this planet. And by 2050, there will be 2 billion more... many moving into urban centers at an unprecedented rate. Making sure there is enough food, fiber and infrastructure for our rapidly growing world is what we're all about at John Deere. And it's why we're investing in our people and our technology like never before! Here the world's brightest minds are tackling the world's biggest challenges. If you believe one person can make the world a better place, we'll put you to work. RIGHT NOW.

John Deere is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regards to, among other things, race, religion, color, national origin, sex, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, status as a protected veteran, or status as a qualified individual with disability.

Primary Location:

Title: Marketing Director
Job_Description:
Availity delivers revenue cycle and related business solutions for health care professionals who want to build healthy, thriving organizations. Availity has the powerful tools, actionable insights and expansive network reach that medical businesses need to get an edge in an industry constantly redefined by change.
Availity is a Healthcare IT company headquartered in Jacksonville, FL with an office in Indianapolis, IN and a significant US based remote workforce. Availity is the nation’s largest health information network, connecting 2 million providers nationwide and processing more than 12 billion transactions a year, and growing! We work collaboratively with health plans and providers to disrupt an antiquated healthcare system by solving core issues in the way stakeholders communicate. Fixing the broken provider data management process and creating real time communication of risk and quality information are just two of the ways Availity is streamlining this process. Availity also offers providers, hospitals, and health systems revenue cycle and patient financial management solutions. We help prepare our providers for the rise in consumerism and value-based care, so that they can get paid accurately, and timely, for their services.

Our mission is to create connections and deliver products that help healthcare businesses succeed. We do this by connecting, delighting, and empowering the nation’s premier healthcare ecosystem; providing multi-stakeholder solutions that simplify the business relationship between providers and health plans.

Title: Marketing Director
Job_Description:
Availity delivers revenue cycle and related business solutions for health care professionals who want to build healthy, thriving organizations. Availity has the powerful tools, actionable insights and expansive network reach that medical businesses need to get an edge in an industry constantly redefined by change.
Availity is a Healthcare IT company headquartered in Jacksonville, FL, with additional offices in Indianapolis, IN, and Bangalore, India, and a significant remote workforce throughout the US. Availity is the nation’s largest health information network, connecting over 2 million providers with health plans nationwide and processing more than 12 billion transactions a year, and growing! We work collaboratively with health plans and providers to disrupt an antiquated healthcare system by offering solutions that solve core issues in how these stakeholders communicate. Availity also provides revenue cycle management solutions to help providers, hospitals, and health systems receive accurate, timely payment for their services.

As the premier healthcare engagement platform, our mission is to create connections and deliver products that help healthcare businesses succeed. We connect, delight, and empower the nation’s premier healthcare ecosystem, providing multi-stakeholder solutions that simplify the business relationship between providers and health plans.

Title: Marketing Director
Job_Description:
Summary:
Analyst II Business Intelligence

ATLAS Technology Group Inc. is located in Bentonville, Arkansas and is one of the fastest growing Business Intelligence software companies in the Region. ATLAS specializes in Retail Analytics, servicing more than 300 vendors in the Retail Industry. If you are self-motivated and looking for a position where you can make an immediate impact, ATLAS would be a great fit for you.
You will be part of a high performance team responsible for delivering customized reporting solutions and providing business intelligence insights. The primary purpose of this position is to design and develop customized analytics solutions to fit the specifications of each customer. This requires consulting with clients to understand their needs and deliver high quality solutions within agreed upon timelines. This person will work within a team but will be responsible for servicing and managing the needs of their assigned clients.
Responsibilities:









Important Information:

Title: Marketing Director
Job_Description:
Company Overview
Every great story has a new beginning. We're excited to announce that Discovery and WarnerMedia have combined to become Warner Bros. Discovery. WBD is a premier global media and entertainment company offering audiences the world’s most differentiated and complete portfolio of content, brands and franchises across television, film, sports, news, streaming and gaming. We’re home to the world’s best storytellers, creating world-class products for consumers. From brilliant creatives to technology trailblazers and beyond, join us as we step into the next chapter.
The Job

Warner Bros. Discovery's DTC technology and product organization sits at the intersection of tech, entertainment, and everyday utility. We are continuously leveraging new technology to build immersive and interactive viewing experiences. Our platform covers everything from search, catalog, and video transcoding, to personalization, global subscriptions, and more. We are committed to delivering quality user experiences, ranging from video streaming to applications across connected TV, mobile, web and consoles. As a pure tech organization, we are essential to Warner Bros. Discovery’s continued growth, building world-class products from the ground-up for our iconic brands like HBO Max, Discovery Channel, CNN, Food Network, HGTV, Eurosport, MotorTrend, and many more.





In compliance with local law, we are disclosing the compensation, or a range thereof, for roles that will be performed in New York City. Actual salaries will vary and may be above or below the range based on various factors including but not limited to location, experience, and performance. The range listed is just one component of Warner Bros. Discovery’s total compensation package for employees. Pay Range: $117,600.00 - $218,400.00 salary per year. Other rewards may include annual bonuses, short- and long-term incentives, and program-specific awards. In addition, Warner Bros. Discovery provides a variety of benefits to employees, including health insurance coverage, an employee wellness program, life and disability insurance, a retirement savings plan, paid holidays and paid time off (PTO).
Warner Bros. Discovery embraces the opportunity to build a workforce that reflects the diversity of our society and the world around us. Being an equal opportunity employer means that we take seriously our responsibility to consider qualified candidates on the basis of merit, without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, mental or physical disability, and genetic information, marital status, citizenship status, military status, protected veteran status or any other category protected by law.
If you’re a qualified candidate with a disability and you need a reasonable accommodation in order to apply for this position, please contact us at recruitadmin@warnermedia.com.

Title: Marketing Director
Job_Description:
No Relocation Assistance Offered
# 137184 - Piscataway, New Jersey, United States

Do you want to come to work with a smile and leave with one as well? In between those smiles, your day consists of working in a global organization, continually learning and collaborating, having stimulating discussions, and making impactful contributions!

If this is how you see your career, Colgate is the place to be!

Our dependable household brands, dedicated employees, and sustainability commitments make us a company passionate about building a future to smile about for our employees, consumers, and surrounding communities. The pride in our brand fuels a workplace that encourages creative thinking, champions experimentation, and promotes authenticity which has contributed to our enduring success. If you want to work for a company that lives by their values, then give your career a reason to smile...every single day.

Title: Marketing Director
Job_Description:
Consistently named one of the top D.C. start-ups to watch since 2016, Quorum builds software that helps public affairs professionals work smarter and move faster. Our philosophy is people-first, whether we're supporting team members in their careers or prioritizing our clients with a best-in-class Customer Success program. Quorum's clients use our tools to bring a modern approach to advocacy work in Congress, all 50 state legislatures, major U.S. cities, the European Union, and more than a dozen countries.
As the Director of Product Design, you'll be responsible for the overall quality of the user experience of our products and will be directly responsible for the day-to-day operations of our five-person Product Design team. As a member of the leadership team for our product & technology organization, you'll report directly to our CTO and work closely with designers, product managers, and engineers to implement your team's design vision. This role is a player-coach role where you'll both manage and coach individual designers and directly participate in the process of improving the usability and user experience of our products.

Title: Marketing Director
Job_Description:
Our success is reliant on building teams that include people from different backgrounds and experiences who can elevate assumptions and ideas with fresh perspectives. We're dedicated to hiring the whole human, not just a resume. To that end, we look for a diverse pool of applicants-including those from historically marginalized groups. We would like to invite you to apply even if you don't think you meet all of the requirements listed below. We don't want a few lines in a job description to get between us and the opportunity to meet you.

The Role

Outreach is transforming how companies engage with their customers. We are looking for an experienced Front-End developer to join our Core Experience org. Your primary focus will be solving challenging technical problems, building performant, maintainable and reliable solutions, delivering value and collaborating with other great engineers, product managers and designers. You will have the opportunity to help contribute to the Outreach brand success.

Title: Marketing Director
Job_Description:
No Relocation Assistance Offered
# 147421 - Piscataway, New Jersey, United States

Do you want to be part of a team that is building a future to smile about? What about having the opportunity to connect with others across the world, full of stimulating discussions, and making impactful contributions? If this is how you see your career, Colgate is the place to be!

Our dependable household brands, dedicated employees, and sustainability commitments make us a company passionate about building a future to smile about for our employees, consumers, and surrounding communities. The pride in our brand fuels a workplace that encourages creative thinking, champions experimentation, and promotes authenticity which has contributed to our enduring success.

Title: Marketing Director
Job_Description:
Mediavine is seeking a Manual QA Engineer to join our Engineering team. We are looking for someone who enjoys solving interesting and complex problems and wants to work with a small team of talented engineers on a product used by thousands of publishers. If you're excited about working in a collaborative environment, then this is the role for you!

About Mediavine
Mediavine is a fast-growing advertising management company representing over 7,500 websites in the food, lifestyle, DIY, and entertainment space. Founded by content creators, for content creators, Mediavine is a Top 20 Comscore property, exclusively reaching over 125 million monthly unique visitors. With best-in-class technology and a commitment to traffic quality and brand safety, we ensure optimal performance for our creators.

Job_Description:
Executive Assistant
Waterstone Properties Group
Needham, MA

We are seeking an organized and efficient Executive Assistant to provide personal and administrative support to the Principal and the Chief Operating Officer of Waterstone Properties Group. The position requires being on-site Monday through Friday, from 8:30 a.m. to 5:00 p.m., at our office in Needham, MA.

Executive Assistant Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree required and 5 to 10 years of experience supporting C-Level Executives
Experience with internal and external communications

Title: Marketing Director
Job_Description:
The Systems Integration Developer will build and refine code to test and debug scripts and programs. Design, code, test and deploy new and existing systems using a variety of programming solutions.
Maintain effective, reusable, and reliable code for relational databases applications.
Automate specific business processes through computer programs.

Title: Marketing Director
Job_Description:
Company Overview
Every great story has a new beginning. We're excited to announce that Discovery and WarnerMedia have combined to become Warner Bros. Discovery. WBD is a premier global media and entertainment company offering audiences the world’s most differentiated and complete portfolio of content, brands and franchises across television, film, sports, news, streaming and gaming. We’re home to the world’s best storytellers, creating world-class products for consumers. From brilliant creatives to technology trailblazers and beyond, join us as we step into the next chapter.
The Job

Warner Bros. Discovery's DTC technology and product organization sits at the intersection of tech, entertainment, and everyday utility. We are continuously leveraging new technology to build immersive and interactive viewing experiences. Our platform covers everything from search, catalog, and video transcoding, to personalization, global subscriptions, and more. We are committed to delivering quality user experiences, ranging from video streaming to applications across connected TV, mobile, web and consoles. As a pure tech organization, we are essential to Warner Bros. Discovery’s continued growth, building world-class products from the ground-up for our iconic brands like HBO Max, Discovery Channel, CNN, Food Network, HGTV, Eurosport, MotorTrend, and many more.





In compliance with local law, we are disclosing the compensation, or a range thereof, for roles that will be performed in New York City. Actual salaries will vary and may be above or below the range based on various factors including but not limited to location, experience, and performance. The range listed is just one component of Warner Bros. Discovery’s total compensation package for employees. Pay Range: $117,600.00 - $218,400.00 salary per year. Other rewards may include annual bonuses, short- and long-term incentives, and program-specific awards. In addition, Warner Bros. Discovery provides a variety of benefits to employees, including health insurance coverage, an employee wellness program, life and disability insurance, a retirement savings plan, paid holidays and paid time off (PTO).
Warner Bros. Discovery embraces the opportunity to build a workforce that reflects the diversity of our society and the world around us. Being an equal opportunity employer means that we take seriously our responsibility to consider qualified candidates on the basis of merit, without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, mental or physical disability, and genetic information, marital status, citizenship status, military status, protected veteran status or any other category protected by law.

Title: Marketing Director
Job_Description:
Consistently named one of the top D.C. start-ups to watch since 2016, Quorum builds software that helps public affairs professionals work smarter and move faster. Our philosophy is people-first, whether we're supporting team members in their careers or prioritizing our clients with a best-in-class Customer Success program. Quorum's clients use our tools to bring a modern approach to advocacy work in Congress, all 50 state legislatures, major U.S. cities, the European Union, and more than a dozen countries.
As the Director of Product Design, you’ll be responsible for the overall quality of the user experience of our products and will be directly responsible for the day-to-day operations of our five-person Product Design team. As a member of the leadership team for our product & technology organization, you’ll report directly to our CTO and work closely with designers, product managers, and engineers to implement your team’s design vision. This role is a player-coach role where you’ll both manage and coach individual designers and directly participate in the process of improving the usability and user experience of our products.

Title: Marketing Director
Job_Description:
Address: USA-IL-Chicago-300 South Riverside Plaza
Store Code: IT Executive & Administration (5118169)

Retail Business Services, ranked No. 25 on Fast Company’s 2022 100 Best Workplaces for Innovators, is the services company of leading grocery retail group Ahold Delhaize USA, currently providing services to five omnichannel grocery brands, including Food Lion, Giant Food, The GIANT Company, Hannaford and Stop & Shop. Retail Business Services leverages the scale of the local brands to drive synergies and provides industry-leading expertise, insights and analytics to local brands to support their strategies. We are committed to diversity, equity and inclusion and we foster a community of belonging where everyone is valued. For more information, visit https:// www.retailbusinessservices.com .

This role leads a team of User Experience and User Interface (UI) Designers. This role has the strategic responsibility for ensuring we understand the industry, product market (broadly) and specific needs of our cross-functional complex user communities – so that we can develop the right features and capabilities within product to maximize use and overall organizational value. This role will lead a team responsible for organizational user experience strategy and for developing and implementing a user-centered design practice that engages with senior leadership at a strategic design level (design thinking, strategy communication), as well as with product leadership and product teams to outline user-centric design practices (user personas, user journeys, user sentiment), user interface development (engineering wireframes, high-fidelity visual prototypes, consistent visual design standards) and user research approach across our Brands. The team works across all portfolios and business units leveraging meaningful user insights to ensure data-driven decision-making – “Making the right things, the right ways”.


Develop, maintain, and lead user experience strategy across the RBS Product Portfolio enterprise.
Lead strategic design sessions with senior leadership to focus on user-focused strategy considerations, and communications.
Lead the development and implementation of UX/UI frameworks and processes
Maintain a holistic view of the work happening across team in order to make connections, identify opportunities, and ensure alignment to strategic priorities.
Drive momentum by keeping active research on track and creating transparency to the overall active research work in flight, in the backlog & completed, and surfacing issues and blocks early.
Display strong consulting and collaboration skills to work with partners to understand business problems and focus on bringing issues to resolution, escalating as necessary to meet timelines.
Oversee the development of user protocols, user interviews, feedback analysis and insights sharing
Responsible for life cycle management of associates with a focus on building capabilities.
Ensure team operates efficiently in an agile product development cycle, delivering continuous insights through lean research practices
Establish the methodology and human-centered design principles leveraging support from other disciplines (i.e., data analytics) as appropriate
Represent the voice of the user and communicate research insights and recommendations in compelling and creative ways with team members and senior leadership
Design and oversee the end-to-end mixed methods research using a variety of qualitative and quantitative methods including interviews, contextual inquiry, surveys, participatory design, statistical analysis, experimental studies, and synthesis of secondary research
Work with Products, Design and Tech partners to represent the needs and priorities of our customers and your team
Ensure that work undertaken by the team is clearly tied to measurable business outcomes


Bachelor's Degree in Business, Computer Science, or related field or equivalent professional work experience/certification
10+ years of professional experience in either a research or digital user-centered product setting
5+ years of leading a team that conducted user experience research and applying findings from such research to the development of products and/or programs
3+ years leading a team that followed iterative design processes, prototyping techniques, storyboarding, visual design, UI
Demonstrated experience working with executive level stakeholders
Experience leading and designing mixed method research projects from inception to completion
Strong background in qualitative research including moderating skills, questionnaire design, discourse analysis, contextual inquiry, and interpretive coding and analysis
Ability to apply basic statistical concepts and tests (t-tests, ANOVA, confidence intervals, sampling, generalizability, etc.) to analysis
Demonstrated ability to drive strategic change in products and initiatives based on customer need, industry shifts and innovation
Demonstrated ability to explain the benefits of user experience research and integrate within the design planning, estimation, and prioritization process
Demonstrated ability to incorporate design thinking into the product development process
Successful performance in a matrixed environment. Demonstrated ability to manage multiple initiatives simultaneously while consistently delivering high quality results.
Product Methodologies, continuous improvement, analytical, problem-solving skills, Demand Management, Performance Metrics, Value-centric, Business Acumen, Collaboration, ability to influence and present at executive level
Retail or Consumer Product Goods industry experience preferred
Product transformation experience a plus
Master’s degree a plus

Our success is reliant on building teams that include people from different backgrounds and experiences who can elevate assumptions and ideas with fresh perspectives. About the Team
The Success Plans Experiences team owns the user experience which consists of a complex React web application. Our mission is to provide fast, reliable communication tools for buyers and sellers alike and to collect and analyze the data rich insights created by those interactions. This team has exciting challenges in store. Success plans are a newer part of the Outreach platform and therefore we have the opportunity to learn from our early customers and shape this into a product that becomes the standard for B2B transactions. Title: Marketing Director
Job_Description:
Company Description
Amwell is a leading telehealth platform in the United States and globally, connecting and enabling providers, insurers, patients, and innovators to deliver greater access to more affordable, higher quality care. Amwell believes that digital care delivery will transform healthcare. We offer a single, comprehensive platform to support all telehealth needs from urgent to acute and post-acute care, as well as chronic care management and healthy living. With over a decade of experience, Amwell powers telehealth solutions for over 150 health systems comprised of 2,000 hospitals and 55 health plan partners with over 36,000 employers, covering over 80 million lives.
Brief Overview:
We're looking for a Group Product Manager to help us deliver on our bold mission. If you want to change the way healthcare is delivered… if you've geeked out on the possibilities of telehealth or how the storm of new virtual care delivery models can transform the way patients receive care… if you're looking for an opportunity to build world-class enterprise telehealth products… then this is the job for you!

Title: Marketing Director
Job_Description:
Hi, we're Nuts.com!
Nuts.com is a self-funded, profitable, rapidly growing multi-channel DTC specialty food and wellness company with over 550 people on our team. We're changing the landscape of snacking on nuts, dried fruit, chocolate and more! We planted our roots in Newark, New Jersey during the Great Depression, selling premium nuts on Mulberry Street's open-air market. We've come quite a long way since then, taking our multi-generational family business online in 1999. Even after 93 years, we continue to pride ourselves in expertly sourcing the highest quality foods and treating our customers like family.
What's our team like? We're driven, collaborative and entrepreneurial. Energy and passion power our business and we look for candidates who share in that excitement to help us continue to build something special.

Title: Marketing Director
Job_Description:
UX Content Strategist

Content StrategyChicago

Description

Credera is looking for an experience design-oriented content strategist to join our XD team of researchers, strategists and designers to create highly usable and enjoyable digital experiences.

This person will play a critical role in understanding and synthesizing user- and data-driven insights along with our client’s business goals in order to set the organizing content vision and strategy, which then will guide our approach for how people understand and interact within a particular digital experience. This person will provide clear guidance to internal teams and clients on how best to structure content, how to prioritize and build hierarchy that helps achieve our objectives and will be a master at editing down to what is simple, digestible, and contextually relevant. They will help ensure we deliver world-class solutions that are easy to use, accessible, engaging and desirable and that contribute to meaningful impact for people and our clients.


Credera is a full-service management consulting, user experience, and technology solutions firm, with clients ranging from Fortune 500 companies to emerging industry leaders


Fortune's Best Workplaces in Consulting & Professional Services
Fortune's Best Workplaces in Texas
Fortune’s Best Workplaces for Millennials
Top Workplaces USA
The Denver Post’s Top Workplaces
The Dallas Morning News’ Top 100 Places to Work
The Houston Business Journal Best Place to Work List


The content strategist will be a passionate, energetic and collaborative member of our team who will:

Work with our clients to help them understand content strategy at large and as it relates to their particular project through meetings, workshops, presentations, thought leadership, etc.
Make content design recommendations that will improve the experience and follow best practices in order to achieve user and business objectives
Help bring the power of the written word and brand storytelling to life and help inspire and push our capabilities
Develop organizing design principles as well as overall information architecture design, content mapping, flows, hierarchies, taxonomies, labeling, metadata frameworks, etc.
Understand and strategize for fluidity and cohesion between multiple touchpoints within an experience ecosystem
Help lead and participate in user research activities and help find and articulate actionable user insights to guide strategy
Help the team understand complex data and articulate actionable insights that will help in our understanding of existing situations and areas of opportunity
Perform competitive content reviews as well as audits to existing content (including its overarching architecture and organization as well the written, audio, visual, and other content types themselves)
Establish content inventory needs and work with designers to develop and deliver related assets
Ensure proper SEO strategies are properly devised and executed as it relates to content planning
Understand and navigate CMS and other technical implications, and assist with the technical integration of content
Strategize and plan for change management and governance as it relates to content updates, migrations and ongoing administration
Establish content guidelines and specifications in order to maintain quality and consistency
Work collaboratively and passionately within the XD team of researchers, strategists, designers and front-end developers as well as other team members across Credera including management consultants, -end developers, project directors, SEO leads, etc.
Lead and inspire others in our XD practice to deliver with excellence and champion the power of strong and consistent content strategy


1-3 years of years of relevant experience developing content strategy independently and within a cross-functional team

Passion for writing compelling content that resonates emotionally with people and an inspiring point of view surrounding the power of narrative, voice and tone
Energy and dedication needed to help grow, nurture and mature the XD team overall and to bring out the XD mindset in order to solve problems for people
typical industry standards like MS Office products, Adobe Creative Suite, Google Analytics, Qualtrics, Adobe Analytics (or other data tools), Figma a plus

Bachelor's or master's degree in a design-related field

Come help us enrich these experiences and provide real value directly to our customers. On the Frontend we use React with Typescript. The National Robotics Engineering Center (NREC) at Carnegie Mellon University is seeking a User Interface Software Engineer to join our top-notch technical team. Be a part of this exciting project that is breaking new ground for NREC!

Couple has an opening for an experienced Junior Web Developer with skills and experience in PHP/MySQL and JavaScript to join a growing team creating a new online-dating product for singles across the globe. We are expanding rapidly and are looking for additional help from a Junior Web Developer to help us scale up our application as we deploy to different venues and verticals.
Couple is a fast-growing startup in the $10B online-dating industry with a product that serves singles in a fun and unique way. Couple’s website technology is currently built on a LAMP stack using Twilio video.
Couple is supported by a PHP/MySQL site and applications using SendGrid and Twilio SMS, along with Facebook and Google APIs for user and event authentication, communication and management; and soon will be working with Stripe for accepting payments.

Title: Marketing Director
Job_Description:
Company Description
Amwell is a leading telehealth platform in the United States and globally, connecting and enabling providers, insurers, patients, and innovators to deliver greater access to more affordable, higher quality care. Amwell believes that digital care delivery will transform healthcare. We offer a single, comprehensive platform to support all telehealth needs from urgent to acute and post-acute care, as well as chronic care management and healthy living. With over a decade of experience, Amwell powers telehealth solutions for over 150 health systems comprised of 2,000 hospitals and 55 health plan partners with over 36,000 employers, covering over 80 million lives.
Brief Overview:
We're looking for a Group Product Manager to help us deliver on our bold mission. If you want to change the way healthcare is delivered… if you've geeked out on the possibilities of telehealth or how the storm of new virtual care delivery models can transform the way patients receive care… if you're looking for an opportunity to build world-class enterprise telehealth products… then this is the job for you!

TYPICAL DUTIES

Title: Marketing Director
Job_Description:
The Role
The Senior Android Developer is responsible for the development and maintenance of applications aimed at Android mobile devices. Your primary focus will be the development of Android applications and their integration with back-end services. You will be working alongside other Engineers and Developers who specialize on different layers of the infrastructure.
As a senior member of the mobile team, you will also be responsible for code quality, mentorship of Junior Developers, and contributing toward the mobile architecture by instilling best practices and avoiding future technology pitfall.
A commitment to collaborative problem solving, sophisticated design, and the creation of quality products is essential.

Title: Marketing Director
Job_Description:
Job Description

New hires based in the US & Puerto Rico will be required to demonstrate that they have been fully vaccinated for COVID-19 or qualify for a medical or religious exemption or accommodation to this vaccination requirement, subject to applicable law.

Our IT team operates as a business partner proposing ideas and innovative solutions that enable new organizational capabilities. We collaborate internationally to deliver the services and solutions that help everyone to be more productive and enable innovation.

The Digital Marketing Solutions team part of the Global AH IT team is looking for a Sr. Specialist Mobile App Analyst to join the Digital Marketing Solutions team. Responsibilities include managing the release of Animal Health’s internal and external iPhone and Android applications; providing consultation to our suppliers to troubleshoot and resolve development and publication issues; reporting and analytics for internal and external mobile apps; liaison with Apple and Google’s review teams; working with other teams in the company to establish quality guidelines; ensuring that mobile apps meet company’s compliance and technical requirements. The position will require mobile development experience and the ability to understand, build, and troubleshoot code from our suppliers, but the mobile app technical lead will not be developing mobile applications themselves. As the position involves providing guidance to other teams and active collaboration with both technical and non-technical personnel, solid technical and non-technical communication skills will be required to succeed.


Review all new mobile app project demand. This is to ensure project fits within our technology stack. The mobile app technical lead involves collaborating with regional IT, agencies, business owners, and other DMS team members. Be an influencer in designing the right technical approach both from an industry standard and from company/DMS guidelines for app development.

internally to our internal Apps store, and externally to the App Store and Google Play Store.

Management and organization of app source code using our BitBucket GIT repository.

Management of users for agencies to ensure appropriate repository access rights.

Submission of compiled code to our vulnerability scanning tool(s), and providing remediation advice to development teams (with assistance from the ITRMS AppSec team).

Compiling apps for testing on approved Merck UAT testing platforms such as MS AppCenter.

Management of Digital Marketing Services’ Apple and Google Play Store accounts, including developer accounts. Including, but not limited to: creating/managing app ids, entitlements, provisioning profiles, signing certificates and keystores; creating store listings; submitting builds for review by Apple/Google; managing TestFlight/Google Play Test channels; and functioning as the liaison between our company and Apple/Google to resolve issues.

Liaison with other teams for release and management of internal applications to the Apps store, including change management administration.

Ensuring apps meet compliance, branding, and security reviews prior to release, including providing suitability advice on future application plans.

Updating the in-house asset management system (WebUniverse) with mobile application details.

Responsible for managing the app analytics and reporting. This includes:

Setting up application projects and providing Firebase configuration files to dev teams.

Setting up Google Firebase analytics reporting for app owners.

Run customized reports as/when requested for certain time periods.

Providing reports from App Store and Google Play Store statistics.

Technical Consultant to App Developers

Supporting agencies and troubleshooting with development issues that may occur, including providing advice based on source code reviews, black box, grey box, or white box testing.

Providing advice/recommending solutions for issues that may be reported during the vulnerability scanning process.

Providing input to agency partners on the implementation of development best practices during the mobile app development lifecycle

Providing advice on types of technologies accepted, and consulting with agencies on development capabilities. This includes working directly with an agency’s app developers to ensure suitability and quality.

Providing cross-platform support and creating builds from multiple different technologies.

Providing implementation advice to agencies and others on consuming remote APIs and web services. A familiarity with the processes involved in back-end server development, including suitable technologies and methodologies is required.

Team collaborator for process improvements

Providing an assessment of our current mobile app governance model to identify possible enhancements and implementation advice.

Contributing to an overall strategy for management of our mobile portfolio.

Assist in implementing maintenance program for all in-scope mobile apps, including on-going support.

Managing the mobile app certification program for agencies, including technical triage and feedback, performance scoring and overall evaluation. This will require a knowledge of software development best practices, as well as mobile app development best practices, as well as experience with meeting current Apple and Google publication requirements.


Bachelor’s Degree

At least 2 years’ professional experience is required developing or QA of applications with: Swift, Java, Kotlin,

Up to 2 years or greater of professional experience developing or QA of applications with Xamarin (.Net) and React-Native.

Unity

Our Animal Health Division is a trusted global leader in veterinary medicine, dedicated to preserving and improving health, well-being, and performance of animals and the people who care for them. We are a global team of professionals working together to make a positive difference in animal care and the world’s food supply and have a deep sense of responsibility towards our customers, consumers, animals, society, and our planet.

Through our commitment to The Science of Healthier Animals®, we offer veterinarians, farmers, pet owners and governments one of the widest ranges of veterinary pharmaceuticals, vaccines and health management solutions and services as well as an extensive suite of digitally connected identification, traceability and monitoring products. We invest in dynamic and comprehensive R&D resources and a modern, global supply chain. We are present in more than 50 countries, while our products are available in some 150 markets.

Who we are …

We are known as Merck & Co., Inc., Kenilworth, New Jersey, USA in the United States and Canada and MSD everywhere else. For more than a century, we have been inventing for life, bringing forward medicines and vaccines for many of the world's most challenging diseases. Today, our company continues to be at the forefront of research to deliver innovative health solutions and advance the prevention and treatment of diseases that threaten people and animals around the world.

What we look for …

Imagine getting up in the morning for a job as important as helping to save and improve lives around the world. Here, you have that opportunity. You can put your empathy, creativity, digital mastery, or scientific genius to work in collaboration with a diverse group of colleagues who pursue and bring hope to countless people who are battling some of the most challenging diseases of our time. Our team is constantly evolving, so if you are among the intellectually curious, join us—and start making your impact today.

Title: Marketing Director
Job_Description:
As a Senior Mobile Software Developer at Credera, you will be a technical leader in a small team deployed to solve our client's hardest problems. You will be responsible to help the team design and estimate implementation tasks, lead implementation work streams, and mentor junior team members.
On a typical day, you might expect to develop a mobile product, implement UX or unit tests, automate application build or deployment tasks, create APIs needed to support your mobile application, or collect and analyze data on user behavior and app performance. You will also lead your team in mobile standards and code reviews, client demos, and other presentations to develop your leadership skills.
When not working on client deliverables, you will have the opportunity to mentor junior team members and support practice and company development through research and development, peer training, and reusable solution accelerator development.

Title: Marketing Director
Job_Description:
MobileChicago

Description

As a Senior Mobile Software Developer at Credera, you will be a technical leader in a small team deployed to solve our client’s hardest problems. You will be responsible to help the team design and estimate implementation tasks, lead implementation work streams, and mentor junior team members.

On a typical day, you might expect to develop a mobile product, implement UX or unit tests, automate application build or deployment tasks, create APIs needed to support your mobile application, or collect and analyze data on user behavior and app performance. You will also lead your team in mobile standards and code reviews, client demos, and other presentations to develop your leadership skills.

When not working on client deliverables, you will have the opportunity to mentor junior team members and support practice and company development through research and development, peer training, and reusable solution accelerator development.


An experienced and driven mobile software engineer that wants to work on challenging and complex technology problems
You enjoy collaborating with a smart and effective team who continually seeks to provide value over what is asked
You often become a SME on a topic and are sought out by others on your team for your technical expertise and opinion
You have a demonstrated ability to quickly learn and adopt new technologies, frameworks, and standards
You are comfortable presenting technical concepts to a client audience, both business and technical
You have a degree in Computer Science/MIS or similar work experience matching the above


Credera is a full-service management consulting, user experience, and technology solutions firm, with clients ranging from Fortune 500 companies to emerging industry leaders
Credera has received a number of state and national awards, including:
Fortune's Best Workplaces in Consulting & Professional Services
Fortune's Best Workplaces in Texas
Top Workplaces USA
The Denver Post’s Top Workplaces
The Dallas Morning News’ Top 100 Places to Work
The Houston Business Journal Best Place to Work List
Fortune’s Best Workplaces for Millennials
Technology Solutions is Credera’s largest practice and focuses on building custom software solutions and integrations for our clients leveraging open source technologies
Technologies we frequently work with include iOS SDKs, Android SDKs, React Native, React, Flutter, REST APIs, Fastlane, Jenkins, Azure DevOps
Programming languages we frequently use include Swift, Kotlin, Java, Dart, Javascript, Bash

How we work

Our foundational competitive advantage is simply doing what we say we will do. To deliver on that advantage, we employ proven product strategy, beautiful visual design and agile software delivery using cross-functional teams. Most teams are a mix of strategy, design and technology consultants working closely with clients to solve their toughest challenges. Inter-discipline collaboration is encouraged among different technology platforms or programming languages because silos don’t build speed.

Like what you hear but worried about high travel? Know that our goal is to keep travel to a minimum and most projects do not require travel. An average would be 0% up to 10%.

Check out our Glassdoor reviews to read what our employees have to say!

Your first week with us

We want you to start your career with Credera simply by spending your first week getting to know the talented individuals that work here. You will learn about our service offerings, focus areas and how we execute projects through informal conversations with leaders from across the firm.

An on-boarding peer will help you walk through all aspects of the Credera work-life and be your guide as you get yourself ready for your first project with us. You will also be treated to lunch by your Practice Leader and Mentor whose jobs are to help you navigate your career at Credera, act as your advocates, make helpful recommendations that align with your strengths, and set you up for success by providing clarity and vision.

Your first six months with us

You will create amazing, custom software solutions that solve our clients' most challenging problems using a combination of industry standard and cutting-edge technologies. You will work on complex, high-volume software solutions that use open source frameworks and client-side technologies. A typical client engagement includes developing a rich UX for mobile devices, ed by REST APIs and monitored with analytics.

You will collaborate with a team of highly qualified and smart individuals to write efficient code, make code modifications, practice test-driven-development, and identify, troubleshoot and solve software defects. Our typical project length is about 6 months and typical team size is 6-8 engineers. We follow an agile methodology on all our projects.

Check out what our teams have done for some of our clients by visiting our Client Stories!

Your first two years with us

At the end of your first two years, you will have worked on multiple projects and been exposed to different sets of technologies and business domains. At this point in your career with us, you will be looking to move to the next level and your efforts will be supported by Credera’s professional development program to help you build the depth and breadth required to advance your career. This includes a roadmap laying out recommended training and development specific to your level, on-the-job training and exposure, internal Credera University classes, and external certifications, conferences, or seminars that align with your personal development and the needs of the firm.

Learn More

Title: Marketing Director
Job_Description:
Location: 2103 Citywest Blvd., Houston, Texas (This is an onsite job.)

Company Background

PCS Software, Inc. is an AI platform for the transportation logistics marketspace providing the trucking industry’s most effective transportation management platform (TMP) to improve fleet management and delivery systems and increase profits for our customers. Through innovation and invention, our software individualizes work routines, consolidates workflows, and streamlines management controls to improve accountability, transparency, and eliminate costly and redundant manual processes.

Trucking companies and freight brokers trust PCS to optimize their dispatch, accounting, and fleet operations. TL, LTL, Intermodal, and freight brokerage services use our TMP to automate operations, easily access information, and reduce inefficiencies to maximize sales and revenue. Founded in 1997 and located in Houston, Texas, PCS Software is the leading developer of hosted software solutions designed specifically for the ground transportation industry.

Senior Mobile Developer

As a Senior Mobile Developer, you will play a major part in developing our product. This will involve research of different features and protocols as well as working on functionality.

Responsibilities

Design and develop state-of-the-art native iOS mobile applications in a collaborative Agile team environment.

Evaluate and provide technical solutions to complex application features and development problems

Identify and help execute ways to increase team and company effectiveness as part of a continuous improvement process

Stay up to date on relevant technologies, trends, and opportunities

Education
BS in Computer Science or related discipline; Advanced degree a plus

Experience

7+ years of experience in software development

5+ years of mobile development experience using iOS and related technologies such as Swift, Objective C

Experience with iOS networking and REST Web Services.

Experience localizing applications for multiple languages

Experience with the full Code-to-Customer lifecycle of the Apple Development Program, including distribution, TestFlight / beta testing, App Analytics, and app management

Experience with software practices of Continuous Integration / Continuous Delivery and automated testing

Commitment to understanding the business domain

Commitment to incorporating quality software practices into all phases of the project lifecycle

Strong problem solving and decision-making skills

Excellent interpersonal, communication, collaboration, and presentation skills

Self-motivated professional who demonstrates strong technical agility and responsiveness

Eager to learn and grow within a technical organization

Experience with geographic mapping APIs, such as HERE maps or Mapbox is a plus

Experience with Azure, C#, Python is a plus

Experience with application security concepts, standards, development, and testing: Azure AD, OAuth, single sign-on, session management, authentication and authorization is a plus

Technical Skills Required


Mac OS, Windows, iOS


Objective-C, Swift, C/C++


MVVM, VIPER, RIBs


GCD, OperationQueue


Xcode, Git, Bitbucket, Bamboo, TeamCity, Jenkins, JIRA


SwiftUI, UIKit, Combine, RxSwift, GraphQL, Alamofire, RIBs, SPM, Carthage, CocoaPods, Buck, Swinject, SwiftLint, SnapKit, iOS SDK, WebSockets, PushKit, UserNotifications, Multiscreen SDK, XML, JSON, Protobuf


Agile, Scrum

PCS Software Mission Statement

At PCS Software, our mission is to create the most effective transportation management system in the country at delivering process improvements that result in greater efficiencies and more profitable outcomes. Through innovation and invention, our intent is to create individualized work routines, comprehensive workflows and thorough management controls that enable our customers to achieve their profitability objectives while improving control and accountability.


High Level of Integrity – You are consistent and uncompromising in your strong personal and company values as well as ethical and business morals.

Can-Do Positive Attitude – You believe in yourself and always demonstrate an achievable attitude.

Motivated – You continuously radiate positive energy and raise the level of performance of those around you by keeping yourself and others positively motivated towards your daily, weekly, monthly, and yearly goals.

Say-Do Ratio – Do what you say and say what you do. You constantly deliver results that match the words you speak. You then keep your promises to deliver on time and keep your peers and management updated to avert a crisis.

Fierce Competitor – You love a challenge, especially when it comes to your performance at work and against external competitors for bragging rights and legacy.

Trustworthy –You earn the trust of others over a period of time, after consistently being honest, always acting with integrity, and never lying or misleading. It is how you act. It is who you are

Team Player - You hold yourself accountable. Take responsibility for your mistakes and look for solutions. Understand how your actions impact the entire group. You welcome collaboration.

Natural Leader – You are usually an extroverted and outgoing person who is naturally very generous, understanding and congenial towards others. You rely on your social ability and have the ability to form friendships and connect with others easily.

Why Join PCS?

PCS Software, Inc. is the perfect combination of a fun work environment that rewards your hard work with amazing opportunities for career growth and personal development. If you want to be the newest member of a vibrant group of energized technology leaders in an innovative and entrepreneurial environment, then apply online today to start building solutions that customers will love to use and join a company that truly rewards your hard work and values your talented contributions. If you would like to compete for this highly sought-after position, please submit your resume to employment@pcssoft.com.

PCS Software, Inc. is also considered one of the best places to work because of our competitive compensation plans, comprehensive benefits plan with 100% company paid medical, dental, and vision premiums for you and your dependents, 401k with a 4% match, generous PTO package, a truly creative and fun working environment, complementary food/beverages in the office, paid training and development opportunities, paid gym/fitness facility membership, employee recognition programs, and amazing opportunities for career growth and personal development.

Work Authorization

No calls or agencies please. PCS Software, Inc. will only employ those who are legally authorized to work in the United States. This is not a position for which sponsorship will be provided. Individuals with temporary visas such as E, F-1, H-1, H-2, L, B, J, or TN or who need sponsorship for work authorization now or in the future, are not eligible for hire.

Warner Bros. Discovery's DTC technology and product organization sits at the intersection of tech, entertainment, and everyday utility. Title: IT Sr. Manager
Job_Description:
Description



This position serves as a IT Project Manager (Journey) with the Prevention and Community Health Division (PCH) of the Washington State Department of Health. Projects include support for the Women, Infant and Children (WIC) Program and are typically considered medium to high-risk IT projects.

Under the supervision of the IT Project Management Office, with input from both the PCH Innovation Manager and the IT Business Liaison for PCH, this position provides information systems and technology project management, project planning, consultation, and contract development/management for the WIC program that will integrate with the Management Information System (MIS) and Electronic Benefits Transfer (EBT) applications.

The IT Project Manager, in alignment with the Office Innovation provides technology solutions and project management in support of the agency’s mission, strategic plan, and the agency’s IT Portfolio.

The incumbent may be located anywhere within the State of Washington. Telework (mobile work) is currently expected. When approved, the incumbent will work with their supervisor to identify an appropriate work schedule and balance including telework and reporting to the Tumwater, WA duty station for work activities as needed.


The vision of the Washington State Department of Health (DOH) is equity and optimal health for all. Our mission is to work with others to protect and improve the health of all people in Washington state. Learn more about the DOH Transformational Plan.


Good organizations know what they do and how they do it. Great organizations also understand why they do it. Our values are:

The Washington State Department of Health acknowledges that our locations statewide are on the homelands of Native people, who have lived in this region from time immemorial. Currently, within the boundaries of Washington State, there are 36 tribes, 29 of which are federally recognized, that share traditional homelands and waterways in what is now Washington State. Some of these are nations and confederacies that represent multiple tribes or bands. We express our most profound respect for and gratitude toward these original and current caretakers of the region. As a public health agency, we acknowledge our responsibility to establish and maintain relationships with these tribes and Native peoples, in support of tribal sovereignty and the inclusion of their voices in public health programs and policies. We pledge that these relationships will consist of mutual trust, respect, and reciprocity.


Washington is America's Top State, according to U.S. News (2021), and provides one of the most competitive benefits packages in the nation.

:



Our ideal candidate has a driving passion for the work, brings humility to their job and interactions, and understands how their actions affect others. They see the needs and objectives of others and take them into account while achieving their objectives, and they adapt their approach and expectations accordingly. Our ideal candidate demonstrates resilience to model outward behaviors including seeing people like ourselves whose goals, objectives, needs, and challenges matter.

Title: IT Sr. Manager
Job_Description:
Address: USA-IL-Chicago-300 South Riverside Plaza
Store Code: IT Executive & Administration (2760798)

Retail Business Services, ranked No. 25 on Fast Company’s 2022 100 Best Workplaces for Innovators, is the services company of leading grocery retail group Ahold Delhaize USA, currently providing services to five omnichannel grocery brands, including Food Lion, Giant Food, The GIANT Company, Hannaford and Stop & Shop. Retail Business Services leverages the scale of the local brands to drive synergies and provides industry-leading expertise, insights and analytics to local brands to support their strategies. We are committed to diversity, equity and inclusion and we foster a community of belonging where everyone is valued. For more information, visit https:// www.retailbusinessservices.com .

Primary Purpose:
The IT Transformation Management Office (TMO) within the Office of the CIO (OCIO) is responsible for planning, strategy and execution of large-scale IT transformation programs including operating model transformations and related people, process and technology/tool transformations across IT and business teams. Given RBS IT’s aspirations to build a modern digital workforce, the Learning & Development lead will be accountable for developing and executing an overall learning strategy to align with IT’s transformation objectives and talent management strategies. This role will also play a key role in shaping talent development programs working closely with the HR teams.


Identify critical skills, capabilities & processes to support the IT’s organizational vision of a modern digital workforce. Build and implement a learning and development strategy and operational plan that is aligned with business goals & objectives.
Responsible for End-to-end design, facilitation, coordination, management and evaluations of learning programs and experiences.
Partner with the change management team to determine learning needs and appropriate delivery approach. Develop strong relationships with stakeholders to ensure all learning solutions are aligned with individual, team, and organizational needs.
Consult with cross functional leaders, coaches, and HR team to provide training expertise, guidance and learning solution recommendations.
Manage third-party resources to facilitate pilot classes, train-the-trainer sessions, classroom training, leadership workshops, and Supplier training and project team meetings in support of training initiatives.
Collaborate to develop project goals, training objectives and measurements by analyzing needs and proposing multiple solutions to drive company and individual performance.
Assist in the development and production/implementation of training materials, procedures and systems in the support of the overall Learning and Development team projects.
Collaborates in the design of an effective career development strategy with an emphasis on continuous learning and development.
Create and maintain vendor relationships, negotiate contracts, and track budget as it relates to learning and development platforms and tools.


Bachelor’s degree in relevant field or equivalent experience
7+ years of experience in Learning & Development strategy and execution in a technology related function/organization.
Demonstrated experience creating and executing a L&D strategy to move to a agile & product/platform based IT operating models.
Knowledge of and expertise in applying learning principles including adult learning, learning styles theory, participatory methods, instructional design, whole systems thinking, and related topics
Self-starter with the ability to lead teams through ambiguity to solve problems and drive results
Proven ability to define and deliver upon metrics for successful evaluation of programs and to meet the strategic L&D need of the organization
Strong organizational, communication, interpersonal, relationship-building skills conducive to collaboration; able to work well in a cross-functional environment
Ability to establish credibility and rapport with senior executives and technical and non-technical team members alike
Proficiency in learning platforms, curriculum development and developing and delivering multi-mode communications (verbal and written) that convey a clear understanding of the unique needs of different audiences.
Demonstrate appropriate influencing skills and independent thinking when working with a broad range of stakeholders, from senior leaders to subject matter experts.


Experience leading learning and development in an IT function.
Experience working in a Product/Platform based operating model.
Experience working with Agile teams

About the Company
Headquartered in West Sacramento, Origin Materials is the world's leading carbon negative materials company. Origin’s mission is to enable the world’s transition to sustainable materials. Over the past 10 years, Origin has developed a platform for turning the carbon found in non-food biomass into useful materials, while capturing carbon in the process. Origin’s patented drop-in core technology, economics and carbon impact have been validated by trusted third parties and are supported by a growing list of major global customers and investors. Origin’s first plant is expected to be operational in 2023 with a second, full-scale commercial plant expected to be operational by 2025 and plans for additional expansion over the next decade.
