Title: Data Scientist
Job_Description:
Imagine a world where you could detect health issues sooner to treat them more effectively. Where food and water are always safe, even in remote corners of the earth. And where scientific and medical research are enhanced to solve the greatest challenges of our times. At PerkinElmer, we imagine this world every day. Then, we innovate and collaborate to make it happen everywhere.

Our dedicated team of employees worldwide, pioneer scientific technologies for better detection, imaging, and informatics to help our customers work to create healthier families, improve the quality of life, and sustain the well-being and longevity of people globally.

If you are seeking a meaningful, impactful, and stimulating career, look no further.

PURPOSE:
Do you thrive in a fast-paced, virtually connected environment? Are you a highly motivated, technology-driven individual who wants to make a difference in the world, from the comfort of your home office?
Reporting to the Global Commercial Digital Enablement lead, and in close connection with both global and regional SMEs across Commercial, R&D, HR, and IT, the Digital Enablement Analyst is responsible for empowering our sales professionals around the world with streamlined, efficient and digitally enhanced workflow solutions. You will be part of an exciting growing team within the organization, empowering business innovation by leveraging emerging technologies and turning them into differentiating business capabilities. The right candidate for this position will be able to quickly toggle between strategic thinking and tactical execution and will have a strong skill set in project prioritization and management, tied to value-driven ROI analyses. In addition, this role will engage across various roles and levels, be an influential thought partner in our digital evolution journey, while fostering an environment that establishes ownership and accountability. You will be responsible for the overall global sales workflow processes and enabling applications, systems and software. You will lead continuous improvement efforts across both new and enhancement projects as you elicit, analyze, validate, specify, verify, and manage the needs of your customers, the internal sales organization and the customers they support.


Influence the execution and future roadmap for the commercial workflow solution from Lead to Cash (sales workflow), driving global process improvement efforts, working alongside key stakeholders both globally and regionally, to drive growth, minimize manual tasks and workflow complexities, while ensuring consistent execution and delivery.
Elevate trends across digital solutions to drive the sales revenue engine, including AI, UX, master data management, emerging analytics and connectivity to customers and markets, assessing their relevance to our products and strategy.
Lead evaluations of data-driven and data-dependent projects to support digital enablement across the sales workflow, owning the global business process and technology roadmaps, inclusive of routine system review and ongoing support.
Own collateral (SOPs, policies, FAQs) to enable and empower field effectiveness and user experience across the sales specific tech stack (eg, Salesforce, Anaplan, Showpad, Spotfire), working with the training center of excellence and the strategic change management and communication team to build a roadmap, manage enhancements, and ensure smooth launch and support of both new and tenured commercial teams.
Champion adoption of best practices, data standards, and data quality across the sales workflow, elevating insights from management of key performance KPI’s, standardizing, preparing and delivering visualizations and analytics across the sales workflow.
Demonstrate leadership acumen by collaborating with others; articulating ideas and viewpoints to senior management, peers and others; identifying and initiating projects; Driving resolution of system issues as needed; and holding self and team accountable for results.
Engage both across global and regional teams, considering the voice of customer, voice of field and voice of managers to optimize processes and the digital solutions and technologies towards revenue generating outcomes.
Share experience and knowledge to assist in the development of recommendations and solutions that are in-line with industry best practices.
Participate in trainings and relevant trade shows to enhance your skills and abilities in data analytics, data visualization and digital enablement solutions.
Support user acceptance testing and end to end validation on all finalized projects to ensure quality and compliance.


Expertise in Data Visualization Tools, preferably Spotfire or similar
Expertise in Microsoft Excel
Proficient in use of SAP, Salesforce or similar
5+ years of experience in sales, marketing, or technology role.


Bachelor’s Degree in Sciences, Business or Data Analytics preferred.
Prior experience in a Commercial B2B organization preferred.
Ability to be a strategic business partner while having impact above and across the organization. Strong strategic and analytical capabilities. Able to influence change without authority.
Exceptional communication skills, able to support independent viewpoints to senior leadership.
The ability to thrive in situations of ambiguity and provide a clear path forward.
demonstrated ability to listen, engage, and translate data and user feedback into actionable insights to support decision-making
Ability to work collaboratively and effectively in team-based environment across key functions and all levels of management within Commercial, as well as other key functions including, but not limited to: Finance, HR, IT, Compliance, Operations, Business Units.
Exhibits strong bias for action and a results orientation, tackling tough problems with firm deadlines, championing positive change
Some travel is required
5 to 8+ years in customer service, operations, sales and/or marketing, both at the global and regional level preferred.


Are you ready to help improve the lives of millions of people and create a healthier world? When you work at PerkinElmer, that’s exactly what you’ll do. From our dedicated scientists and world-class operations employees to our innovative R&D professionals and committed sales and service groups, we’re a unique team of global colleagues who come to work every day knowing we’re making a difference. Through innovation, collaboration, and belief in our mission, we strive to create an inspiring and inclusive culture for our employees, so they can be their best and, together, create a better tomorrow.

Description



This position is responsible for IT support for a highly technical group of Epidemiologists and Scientists at the State-of-the-Art Public Health Lab in Shoreline WA, as well as an office environment in Kent.

As the Network and Telecommunications subject matter expert for the Seattle Service Desk Field Team, you’ll provide tier 1 and tier 2 technical support for the DOH facilities located in Shoreline and Kent. This position applies advanced technical knowledge and considerable discretion to evaluate and resolve tasks of medium complexity.

It coordinates with central teams on more complex tasks such as planning and directing large-scale projects; conducting capacity planning; directing or facilitating the installation of complex systems, hardware, software, application interfaces.

This position acts as the “face” of OIT by responding to technical support requests and making sure that all issues are resolved and/or routed to the proper staff for resolution by performing the following:

Service Desk technicians promote and protect public health by providing technical and organizational support pertaining to technical and software related needs so that we help those who serve promote and protect public health.

The duty station for this position is in Shoreline, WA. Telework (mobile work) is currently expected. When approved, the incumbent is expected to report to the duty station for work activities. Partial telecommuting may be an option subject to supervisory approval. It is anticipated that the incumbent would be expected at the Shoreline, WA duty station for work activities 5-days weekly. The incumbent will report for work at either the Shoreline or Kent facility depending on the needs.

This is a full-time permanent position.


The vision of the Washington State Department of Health (DOH) is equity and optimal health for all. Our mission is to work with others to protect and improve the health of all people in Washington state. Learn more about the DOH Transformational Plan.


Good organizations know what they do and how they do it. Great organizations also understand why they do it. Our values are:

The Washington State Department of Health acknowledges that our locations statewide are on the homelands of Native people, who have lived in this region from time immemorial. Currently, within the boundaries of Washington State, there are 36 tribes, 29 of which are federally recognized, that share traditional homelands and waterways in what is now Washington State. Some of these are nations and confederacies that represent multiple tribes or bands. We express our most profound respect for and gratitude toward these original and current caretakers of the region. As a public health agency, we acknowledge our responsibility to establish and maintain relationships with these tribes and Native peoples, in support of tribal sovereignty and the inclusion of their voices in public health programs and policies. We pledge that these relationships will consist of mutual trust, respect, and reciprocity.


Washington is America's Top State, according to U.S. News (2021), and provides one of the most competitive benefits packages in the nation.

:



Our ideal candidate has a driving passion for the work, brings humility to their job and interactions, and understands how their actions affect others. They see the needs and objectives of others and take them into account while achieving their objectives, and they adapt their approach and expectations accordingly. Our ideal candidate demonstrates resilience to model outward behaviors including seeing people like ourselves whose goals, objectives, needs, and challenges matter.


Option 1: Six or more years of recent (within the past 6 months) information technology experience in information technology related activities such as testing, installing, maintaining, supporting and/or averting current hardware/software system failures on client applications, hardware, or software products.

Or

And

Four (4) or more years of experience with Service Now or similar IT Service Management platform.

Three (3) or more years of experience working with a knowledge base.

We are PepsiCo
PepsiCo is a global food and beverage leader operating in more than 200 countries with a product portfolio that includes 22 world-famous, billion-dollar brands. From Gatorade to Quaker, to LIFEWTR, to Lay’s, we make hundreds of enjoyable foods and beverages that are loved throughout the world.

Position Information
Do you have a Bachelor's degree in Biology or a related science field? Would you like to serve the community and help protect the environment and the public? Join our dynamic and innovative team as an Environmental Health Specialist (EHS) Trainee!
Starting salary up to $40.78/hour ($85,112/year), a cash allowance of $600/month, and a competitive total compensation package!*
These positions may be filled at either the Trainee, I, or II level. If you are interested in applying at the I or II level, you will need to apply to the separate, concurrent recruitments being conducted.
Please Note: The EHS Trainee positions require possession of a valid letter of eligibility issued by the State of California to start an EHS Trainee program. For more information on the requirements and process to obtain a letter of eligibility, please visit the CA Registered Environmental Health Specialist Program website.


Working at the County of Sonoma offers expansive opportunities for growth and development, the ability to be a part of a challenging and rewarding work environment, and the satisfaction of knowing you're working to better our communities. You can also look forward to flexible work arrangements and excellent benefits* including:
As an EHS Trainee, we help you build your career in Environmental Health to gain training and work under close supervision in all aspects of the EHS profession. An EHS Trainee is responsible for learning to perform the necessary tasks to protect public health, serve the community, and support the functions of the Environmental Health Section. EHS positions perform routine inspections, investigate complaints and achieve compliance with County and State regulations in all Environmental Health programs. These include Food Facilities, Recreational Facilities, Cannabis Facilities, Medical Waste Facilities, Water Systems, Beach monitoring, Solid Waste, Body Art, Childhood Lead Prevention, Storm Water, Organized Camps, Detention Facilities, and Disaster Preparedness. An EHS Trainee will communicate regularly with their supervisor to calibrate expectations and ensure that a consistent approach is being maintained. They will interact with the public and other agencies and also learn to:
Environmental Health staff generally work day shifts from Monday-Friday and may be asked to occasionally work weekends and evenings to conduct field inspections at temporary events and investigate complaints. As many functions occur outdoors, staff should be prepared to work in a variety of conditions from freshwater and ocean water sampling, to solid waste inspections at transfer stations and food safety inspections at restaurants in various weather conditions. Peak work activity periods are typically from May through October with ongoing routine food inspection and then starting the bulk of pool inspections, community events inspections, and organized camp inspections.

The ideal candidates will possess the written and oral communication skills necessary to effectively respond to citizen complaints and prepare reports. Teamwork, professionalism, and a positive outlook are highly desired for this position. The ideal candidates will also possess:
As an EHS Trainee, your employment would be limited to a maximum of thirty-six months. Within that period, you are expected to obtain a certificate of registration as an Environmental Health Specialist (REHS) issued by the State of California. After you obtain your California REHS certificate, and based upon your performance and mastery of the Trainee position, you would then be eligible for promotion to Environmental Health Specialist I, within three years from your appointment as an EHS Trainee. EHS Trainees serve a one year probationary period.


This recruitment is being conducted to fill multiple full-time positions and one part-time position in the Department of Health Services. This employment list may also be used to fill future full-time, part-time, or extra-help (temporary) positions as they occur during the active status of the list.

Title: Data Scientist
Job_Description:
Why We Exist
Fat is good. "Vegetable" oils are bad. Bad for us. Bad for the planet. How bad?

Increased consumption of vegetable oils is shown to increase the risk of death by 62%, more than moderate smoking. They're also killing the planet. Four of the top five greenhouse gas emitting crops are industrially produced seed oils. And they are hidden everywhere. The average American consumes a staggering 20% of their calories from vegetable oils.

We're on a mission to replace these "vegetable" oils in the food system. We believe they are one of the biggest problems when it comes to both rising rates of chronic disease and agricultural impact on climate change and ecosystem destruction. We're using the ancient art of fermentation to make healthier and more sustainable oils and fats. We need your help! Read below to see if your skills can help us make this a movement that changes the world.

Title: Data Scientist
Job_Description:
Glanbia Business Services
Customer Analytics Data Scientist

An exciting opportunity has arisen for a Customer Analytics Data Scientist to join Glanbia’s Centre of Excellence for Business Intelligence and Data Analytics. This a permanent role and will report to the Data Analytics Lead, CoE for BI and Data Analytics.

Glanbia - Our Business
Glanbia is a global nutrition company and the global leader in the performance nutrition industry with a portfolio of performance and lifestyle nutrition brands. As a nutritional solutions provider in the B2B arena, we commercialise specialty nutritional, functional ingredients and precision premixes to meet our customer needs. Glanbia’s growth has been achieved both organically and via targeted M&A to scale positions and build into adjacencies in attractive segments aligned with our purpose.
each of our own brands has its own consumer appeal. We are the #1 global sports nutrition brand with a growing presence in lifestyle nutrition.
our portfolio of both nutritional ingredients and cheese products gives us strong market reach and customer relevance. We work closely with our customers to develop products that exceed their expectations.
our digital platforms enhance engagement with our consumers at multiple touch points throughout their purchasing decision journey. We will continue to connect with consumers through creative excellence and new digital layers of services.
Employing over 6,000 people across 32 countries, our products are sold or distributed in over 100 countries with total Group revenue of €4.2bn. We have three segments: Glanbia Performance Nutrition, Glanbia Nutritionals and Joint Ventures & Associates. Our shares are listed on the Irish and London Stock Exchanges (symbol: GLB). http://www.glanbia.com

Location
The role will be based in Aurora, Illinois, with a blended working arrangement available through our Smart Working model, which allows greater flexibility in how you work.

This role is Professional Level Step 1 on the Glanbia career framework.

Overview
An exciting opportunity has arisen in the Glanbia Data Analytics team to work across a range of customer focussed business analytics and data science activities. This role will deliver actionable, data-driven insights to help Glanbia better understand their customers and how to market to them. The role will support all Glanbia divisions but will be focused initially on the Glanbia Performance Nutrition business, supporting their consumer and customer teams.


Propose data science problem solving approaches to business challenges.
Work closely with business stakeholders to translate their functional requirements into new reports and applications developed in Tableau to support executive decision making.
Help to create data models for the business that focus on customer lifetime value (CLTV) and cost of acquisition, creating customer cohorts and segments that can be reported on to learn more about our customers.
Lead customer propensity analysis and leverage this intelligence to improve marketing and trade strategy.
Review quantitative and qualitative data to learn about customer motivation, leveraging data to support business interests.
Tell compelling stories about how customers use our products through clear reporting and the delivery of key insights in self-service dashboards for business use.

Requirements
Education

Primary degree and/or Masters qualification in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Data Science or a related quantitative discipline, or the equivalent work experience.

Experience
Naturally inquisitive, pro-active problem solver with a creative mindset.
3-4 years of prior experience working in a consumer, retail, marketing or customer analytics role.
Domain experience in areas such as customer analytics, customer acquisition and retention, marketing effectiveness, consumer sentiment and retail business would be beneficial.
Proven track record of delivering data insights to feed strategic decision making.
Experience developing and maintaining production ready data analytics applications to generate insight, recognise patterns, predict behaviour and deliver content directly to users of information products.
Enjoy working in a fast-paced environment.
Fluent English speaker.

Skills and Competencies
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organise, analyse, and disseminate significant amounts of information with high level of accuracy and attention to detail.
Knowledge and experience cleaning and preparing data for integration into production environments using R or Python.
Knowledge and experience with a version control system (e.g. Git).
Logical thinker with a pro-active attitude, problem solving skills and demonstrable experience working with both structured and unstructured data.
Good organizational skills with experience supporting cross-functional teams.
Good working knowledge and understanding of database structures, SQL and experience querying databases using SQL.
Good understanding of data visualization with experience developing data driven applications in front-end visualization software (e.g. Tableau, Qlik, Looker etc.) or using JavaScript based tools (e.g. d3).

At Glanbia, we celebrate diversity, because we know that our individual strengths make us stronger together. We welcome and encourage interest from a wide variety of candidates, and we will give your application consideration, without regard to race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, or disability status.

At Glanbia our culture will celebrate individuality, knowing that together we are more!

Title: Data Scientist
Job_Description:
Abbott is a global healthcare leader that helps people live more fully at all stages of life. Our portfolio of life-changing technologies spans the spectrum of healthcare, with leading businesses and products in diagnostics, medical devices, nutritionals and branded generic medicines. Our 113,000 colleagues serve people in more than 160 countries.
Research Scientist Clinical Research
About Abbott
Abbott is a global healthcare leader, creating breakthrough science to improve people’s health. We’re always looking towards the future, anticipating changes in medical science and technology.
Our nutrition business develops science-based nutrition products for people of all ages, from helping babies and children grow, to keeping adult bodies strong and active. Millions of people around the world count on our leading brands – including Similac®, PediaSure®, Pedialyte®, Ensure®, Glucerna® and ZonePerfect® – to help get the nutrients they need to live their healthiest life.

Title: Data Scientist
Job_Description:
Why you should join us:
At Sound Agriculture, we believe our food system can nourish consumers, farming communities, and the planet. Through a deeper understanding of plant and microbial biology, we are leveraging the natural power of plants to make agriculture more agile and resilient. Our work focuses on developing nutrient efficiency products and modernizing plant breeding to improve the way we farm and the food we eat. Sound is a Series C startup funded by leading investors in food and agriculture such as Leaps by Bayer, Northpond Ventures, S2G Ventures, Fall Line Capital, Cultivian Sandbox Ventures, Cavallo Ventures and Syngenta Group Ventures.
What you'll do:
We are hiring a Senior Data Scientist to accelerate development of the methods, analyses, and digital workflows that comprise the heart of Sound's discovery engine for epigenetic traits and agronomic active ingredients. Come help refine the epigenetic methods we use to develop nutritious and resilient crops – far faster than gene editing – and help us optimize our discovery pipeline for active ingredients that sustainably improve crop performance. Our aim is to unleash the power of plants to create a more agile and resilient food system, and we've gotten a great start: our product SOURCE, already being used on more than 1 million acres, stimulates already-present soil microbes to fix nitrogen so that farmers need less synthetic fertilizer. We are saving grower costs, boosting yield, and making agriculture more sustainable.
The Senior Data Scientist will help grow the organization as a combination of a hands-on developer, data architect, and expert data science practitioner with authority to make strategic decisions and lead development. The Senior Data Scientist will design, develop, enhance, maintain, and use data architecture including cloud compute services, knowledge discovery platforms, and advanced experimental automation. We currently work across AWS services (S3, Nextflow, docker), on-site genomic data generation (Oxford Nanopore), SaaS LIMS, and ML models running on custom high performance computing, with increasing levels of automation and abstraction. We democratize analysis using custom microservices, jupyter notebooks, and stats/viz packages like JMP. This role will help determine what's next.
The Senior Data Scientist role reports to the Director, Data Science and will interact with functions across the company as a project and team lead. This role is a hybrid onsite position based in our Emeryville, CA headquarters.

Trait Optimization is a multi-disciplinary group within Biotechnology R&D which develops and delivers industry leading solutions for a spectrum of crop research pipeline spanning molecular design to trait performance. The Data Scientist will work with a highly talented research team to address critical predictive analytics strategies, leveraging a rich data landscape from diverse crop/plant/trait evaluation platforms.

Title: IT Specialist, Cloud Platform Engineer
Job_Description:
Availity delivers revenue cycle and related business solutions for health care professionals who want to build healthy, thriving organizations. Availity has the powerful tools, actionable insights and expansive network reach that medical businesses need to get an edge in an industry constantly redefined by change.
Availity is a Healthcare IT company headquartered in Jacksonville, FL with an office in Indianapolis, IN and a significant US based remote workforce. Availity is the nation’s largest health information network, connecting 2 million providers nationwide and processing more than 12 billion transactions a year, and growing! We work collaboratively with health plans and providers to disrupt an antiquated healthcare system by solving core issues in the way stakeholders communicate. Fixing the broken provider data management process and creating real time communication of risk and quality information are just two of the ways Availity is streamlining this process. Availity also offers providers, hospitals, and health systems revenue cycle and patient financial management solutions. We help prepare our providers for the rise in consumerism and value-based care, so that they can get paid accurately, and timely, for their services.

Our mission is to create connections and deliver products that help healthcare businesses succeed. Duties and Responsibilities;
Designs, builds, manages, and operate Azure Core Services with automation and infrastructure as code
Designs, builds, manages, and operates the continuous delivery framework and tools, manages, and automates the lifecycle of the different platform components and help support product teams

Collaborate with Solution architecture, Platform engineering and Product teams for delivering solutions
Work within a project management/agile scrum teams in a leading role as part of a wider team,
Maintain and follow Security practices while building and supporting the platform.

Qualifications;
Azure Virtual Network, VWAN, Express route, Load Balancer (L4/L7), Traffic Manager, CDN, Azure DNS, routing & routing protocols like BGP, firewall concepts
Azure AD, PIM, Conditional Access, MFA, Azure AD Connect, Password less sign-ins, Microsoft Defender, key vault
Azure Governance, Security, Monitoring, Workbooks, Compliance, and cost awareness
Azure Virtual Machines, Containers and/or Kubernetes and/or OpenShift (infrastructure perspective)
Azure Storage Account, Disk, Snapshot, Backup, Site Recovery, file sync, Data Lake
Preffered Qyalifications;
Azure DevOps -preferred, Azure Solutions Architect -preferred
Experience working in Product development/engineering teams

Title: 2023 Commodities and Global Markets - Full-Time Graduate Analyst Program
Job_Description:
Job Description and Qualifications
Air Products (NYSE:APD) touches the lives of consumers around the globe in positive ways every day. Passionate about serving energy, environment, and emerging markets, we provide essential industrial gases, related equipment, and applications expertise to customers in dozens of industries, including refining, chemical, metals, electronics, manufacturing, and food and beverage. We are also the global leader in the supply of liquefied natural gas process technology and equipment. Air Products develops, engineers, builds, owns, and operates some of the world's largest industrial gas projects, including gasification projects that sustainably convert abundant natural resources into syngas for the production of high-value power, fuels, and chemicals. We had fiscal sales of $10.3 billion from operations in more than 50 countries.

More than 21,000 hard-working and committed employees from a diverse group of backgrounds are driven by Air Products’ higher purpose to build innovative solutions that benefit the environment, improve sustainability, and address the challenges facing customers, communities, and the world.


Our Digital Technology team is expanding to meet growing business needs across the world. We’re making a significant investment in our people and systems to strengthen our digital foundation, drive business optimization and improve our customer experience. If you want to help us achieve these goals, we would like you to consider joining our team!

If you are currently a student pursuing an Information Technology related degree and will graduate between December 2022 and August 2023, we invite you to apply to our rotational program today!

Our Career Development (Rotational) Program (CDP) is crafted for entry-level IT / Digital Technology specialists (0-2 years of experience). The CDP provides an opportunity to gain technical experience and network with professionals in various areas of our D.T. organization. The program consists of three, 12-month rotations that can include technical assignments in Digital Enterprise Systems and Software development, infrastructure services, information security, data analytics, and enterprise architecture.


We thank all applicants in advance for their interest; however, only those applicants who are being considered for interviews will be contacted.

Air Products is an Equal Opportunity Employer (U.S.) All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, age, citizenship, gender, marital status, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, disability, or veteran status.

Title: 2023 Commodities and Global Markets - Full-Time Graduate Analyst Program
Job_Description:
At Dura-Line, we aspire to create a more connected world, because we believe every company, every community, every person deserves the chance to advance their lives through better access to high-speed broadband. We take pride in our state-of-the-art quality products and being recognized a key partner with all of the major telecommunications companies across the world. In one year, Dura-Line produced over 1.4 billion feet of digital network infrastructure. Dura-Line creates what connects us. Every time you pick up your cell phone, log into the internet, or use your i-anything, it’s because our HDPE pathways protect that delicate string of glass called a fiber optic cable that carries everything from precious pictures of your puppy to the latest sports scores. Your safety, health, family, work, entertainment…your whole life; that’s our connection.

Dura-Line is growing fast creating what connects us and transforming the structure of communication. We are currently hiring a driven and innovative Product Manager that will influence cross-functional teams to drive product ideas and new product introduction coordination from concept to production, solve product-related questions or performance issues, manage process improvement projects, offer input for marketing content development, and assist on new vendor selection/approval. Take the lead and use your passion and ingenuity in this role to provide proactive technical leadership to help quality manage customer complaint process using standard root cause problem solving and analysis, countermeasure documentation, and learning knowledge passed through appropriate functional groups and team members.

We are in search of someone that is a problem solver, is eager to learn, is a great communicator, product harmonization, product offerings, and product development. This is a vital role to the organization to develop product management documentation and control procedures for the life of the product and use standard practices for new product introduction coordination.

In this role, personality is crucial and communication skills are required as you will need to bring your customer-centric and open-minded approach to articulate thoughts and influence direct and cross-functional teams. We are looking for a business or engineer strategist that can bring products to life. To hit the ground running, you must have a strong foundation and 3-5 years of experience in a Product Manager role which will help you to drive change while building relationships and partnerships and influence other functions to accomplish related goals and objectives.

We are looking for someone who is a self-starter that wants to be a builder of ideas and innovation to manage product development activities while being active in participation in regional industry ﻿standards/regulatory boards and committees to drive positive outcomes for Dura-Line. A thought leader for standard product performance monitoring, reporting, or competitive activity management and someone with experience in the infrastructure/telecommunication and/or manufacturing/plastic pipe extrusion industries will be a plus.

In addition, you will participate in the technical community of practice by providing process coordination to develop centralized standards for training materials, curriculum delivery, technical support information, and problem-solving best practices, by designing tools/programs with the flexibility to adopt standards to the company culture.

Why work at Dura-Line?

401k with 6% company match (company will automatically contribute an extra 3% of your plan-eligible pay to your 401k).

Multi-tier benefits (Medical, Dental, Vision) that you can tailor for yourself and dependents which includes Employer paid Short-Term Disability, Long-Term Disability, & Life Insurance

We also offer an inclusive relocation assistance package

Wellness Employee Assistance Program (EAP), paid parental leave, Fitness & Weight-loss Reimbursement

Additional benefits include tuition reimbursement, 11 paid company holidays, paid time off/vacation time, career development opportunities, and many other benefits in a collaborative culture that focuses on work & life balance, innovation, & teamwork. Benefits start at day one!

Discover how Dura-Line creates what connects us. Every day, in the little ways and the big ones, our lives depend on clear, consistent, reliable communication. Check out our products, history, and testimonials and apply today at www.Dura-Line.com.

All employees are subject to pre-employment Background Check and Drug Screening and employment is contingent upon successful clearance of both. Dura-Line is an Equal Opportunity Employer and participates in the federal E-Verify program to verify the work eligibility of all new hires.

#DLIND123

#USIND123

Dura-Line offers all its employees an exciting work environment and provides career opportunities in a continuously growing company. We are committed to attracting, developing, and retaining a diverse workforce that represents our global customer base. Check out our products, history, and testimonials at www.Dura-Line.com

Dura-Line is part of a community of companies, known as Orbia , bound together by a shared purpose: to advance life around the world. Orbia’s business groups have a collective focus on insuring food security, reducing water scarcity, reinventing the future of cities and homes, connecting communities to data infrastructure, and expanding access to health and wellness with advanced materials. The business groups include Precision Agriculture, Building and Infrastructure, Fluor, Polymer Solutions, and Data Communications, which collectively pursue human centric solutions to global challenges.

PRODUCTS WE ENGINEER :
We design and develop products that deliver highly accurate flow measurements, up to 0.25%. In magnetic flowmeters this requires generating controlled magnetic fields to induce a microvolt signal which is converted, temperature compensated, and communicated in analog or digital forms to higher level control systems. They are capable of Modbus, Fieldbus, Ethernet, Profibus, 4-20 mA and local display outputs, while being both explosion proof and intrinsically safe.

Every great story has a new beginning.

We're excited to announce that Discovery and WarnerMedia have combined to become Warner Bros. Discovery. Our mission is simple. To be the world's best storytellers with world-class products for consumers.

Title: 2023 Commodities and Global Markets - Full-Time Graduate Analyst Program
Job_Description:
Availity delivers revenue cycle and related business solutions for health care professionals who want to build healthy, thriving organizations. Availity has the powerful tools, actionable insights and expansive network reach that medical businesses need to get an edge in an industry constantly redefined by change.
Availity is a Healthcare IT company headquartered in Jacksonville, FL with an office in Indianapolis, IN and a significant US based remote workforce. Availity is the nation’s largest health information network, connecting 2 million providers nationwide and processing more than 12 billion transactions a year, and growing! We work collaboratively with health plans and providers to disrupt an antiquated healthcare system by solving core issues in the way stakeholders communicate. Fixing the broken provider data management process and creating real time communication of risk and quality information are just two of the ways Availity is streamlining this process. Availity also offers providers, hospitals, and health systems revenue cycle and patient financial management solutions. We help prepare our providers for the rise in consumerism and value-based care, so that they can get paid accurately, and timely, for their services.

Our mission is to create connections and deliver products that help healthcare businesses succeed. We do this by connecting, delighting, and empowering the nation’s premier healthcare ecosystem; providing multi-stakeholder solutions that simplify the business relationship between providers and health plans.

Title: 2023 Commodities and Global Markets - Full-Time Graduate Analyst Program
Job_Description:
Our success is reliant on building teams that include people from different backgrounds and experiences who can elevate assumptions and ideas with fresh perspectives. We're dedicated to hiring the whole human, not just a resume. To that end, we look for a diverse pool of applicants-including those from historically marginalized groups. We would like to invite you to apply even if you don't think you meet all of the requirements listed below. We don't want a few lines in a job description to get between us and the opportunity to meet you.

About the Team
The Success Plans Experiences team owns the user experience which consists of a complex React web application. Our mission is to provide fast, reliable communication tools for buyers and sellers alike and to collect and analyze the data rich insights created by those interactions. This team has exciting challenges in store. Success plans are a newer part of the Outreach platform and therefore we have the opportunity to learn from our early customers and shape this into a product that becomes the standard for B2B transactions. In addition we are tasked with integrating this product thoughtfully into the rest of the Outreach platform. We’ll do this while adopting Outreach and industry best practices to ensure our software is truly enterprise grade.

Title: 2023 Commodities and Global Markets - Full-Time Graduate Analyst Program
Job_Description:
Join Macquarie’s Commodity and Global Markets, Credit Markets Division as a Loan Closing and Operations Analyst.
In this role, where you will be part of a dynamic team that supports a portfolio of structured asset backed loans and the direct lending market. On a day-to-day basis, you will work directly with originators, credit risk, legal and other members of the Macquarie Group in the deal formation, structuring and approval phase of lending and structured transactions. Sitting on the trading floor, you will be immersed within the day-to-day business operations and have an opportunity to leverage your subject matter expertise in the leverage loans space alongside our sales and lending team.
In this role, you will deliver through a hands-on approach directly supporting the front office, drafting trade documents, working directly with clients, and assisting them throughout the lending process. You will have daily interaction with the front office and be responsible for seeing transactions end to end, ensuring deals are booked, documents are drafted and liaising with the back office and clients to ensure transactions are executed and settled on-time. You will also have daily interaction with external clients while you work through the document negotiation and drafting process alongside our legal team. Possessing a strong professional image and communication style will ensure that you are successful in this role.

Title: 2023 Commodities and Global Markets - Full-Time Graduate Analyst Program
Job_Description:
At Dura-Line, we aspire to create a more connected world, because we believe every company, every community, every person deserves the chance to advance their lives through better access to high-speed broadband. We take pride in our state-of-the-art quality products and being recognized a key partner with all of the major telecommunications companies across the world. In one year, Dura-Line produced over 1.4 billion feet of digital network infrastructure. Dura-Line creates what connects us. Every time you pick up your cell phone, log into the internet, or use your i-anything, it’s because our HDPE pathways protect that delicate string of glass called a fiber optic cable that carries everything from precious pictures of your puppy to the latest sports scores. Your safety, health, family, work, entertainment…your whole life; that’s our connection.
The Manufacturing Controller is responsible for development and maintenance of the Company’s standard cost system for its manufacturing operations in the U.S., on-going monitoring of manufacturing costs and associated variances along with plant profitability. This position will be the principal resource to provide meaningful operations analysis to the V.P of Operations, Plant Managers, and the Senior Management Team, including development and deployment of operating improvement.

Title: 2023 Commodities and Global Markets - Full-Time Graduate Analyst Program
Job_Description:
Join Macquarie’s Commodities and Global Markets Group in Houston and become a part of the Business Analytics and Data Automation team. This is an exciting and challenging role wherein you will report to a global stakeholder and customer base spread across the entirety of the CGM businesses.
In this position, you will work in a small global team on various business initiatives to support controls, reporting, and analytical tools across the business. As a member of the team, you will be required to collaborate effectively with a global team of traders, market analysts, business analysts, and operations support staff to understand and gather requirements. Then, leverage existing tools and/or develop new solutions to build on these requirements and deliver actionable analysis with timely alerts and visualizations.
Part of the role will also be in helping to identify solutions to replace legacy technologies. This role will give you an opportunity to work independently on technical solutions to business problems as they arise and you will be expected to design, build, document and maintain efficient, reusable, and reliable workflows and solutions. Key stakeholders range from traders to Senior management across the whole business.

Title: 2023 Commodities and Global Markets - Full-Time Graduate Analyst Program
Job_Description:
Imagine a world where you could detect health issues sooner to treat them more effectively. Where food and water are always safe, even in remote corners of the earth. And where scientific and medical research are enhanced to solve the greatest challenges of our times. At PerkinElmer, we imagine this world every day. Then, we innovate and collaborate to make it happen everywhere.

Our dedicated team of employees worldwide, pioneer scientific technologies for better detection, imaging, and informatics to help our customers work to create healthier families, improve the quality of life, and sustain the well-being and longevity of people globally.

If you are seeking a meaningful, impactful, and stimulating career, look no further.

PURPOSE:
Do you thrive in a fast-paced, virtually connected environment? Are you a highly motivated, technology-driven individual who wants to make a difference in the world, from the comfort of your home office?
Reporting to the Global Commercial Digital Enablement lead, and in close connection with both global and regional SMEs across Commercial, R&D, HR, and IT, the Digital Enablement Analyst is responsible for empowering our sales professionals around the world with streamlined, efficient and digitally enhanced workflow solutions. You will be part of an exciting growing team within the organization, empowering business innovation by leveraging emerging technologies and turning them into differentiating business capabilities. The right candidate for this position will be able to quickly toggle between strategic thinking and tactical execution and will have a strong skill set in project prioritization and management, tied to value-driven ROI analyses. In addition, this role will engage across various roles and levels, be an influential thought partner in our digital evolution journey, while fostering an environment that establishes ownership and accountability. You will be responsible for the overall global sales workflow processes and enabling applications, systems and software. You will lead continuous improvement efforts across both new and enhancement projects as you elicit, analyze, validate, specify, verify, and manage the needs of your customers, the internal sales organization and the customers they support.


Influence the execution and future roadmap for the commercial workflow solution from Lead to Cash (sales workflow), driving global process improvement efforts, working alongside key stakeholders both globally and regionally, to drive growth, minimize manual tasks and workflow complexities, while ensuring consistent execution and delivery.
Elevate trends across digital solutions to drive the sales revenue engine, including AI, UX, master data management, emerging analytics and connectivity to customers and markets, assessing their relevance to our products and strategy.
Lead evaluations of data-driven and data-dependent projects to support digital enablement across the sales workflow, owning the global business process and technology roadmaps, inclusive of routine system review and ongoing support.
Own collateral (SOPs, policies, FAQs) to enable and empower field effectiveness and user experience across the sales specific tech stack (eg, Salesforce, Anaplan, Showpad, Spotfire), working with the training center of excellence and the strategic change management and communication team to build a roadmap, manage enhancements, and ensure smooth launch and support of both new and tenured commercial teams.
Champion adoption of best practices, data standards, and data quality across the sales workflow, elevating insights from management of key performance KPI’s, standardizing, preparing and delivering visualizations and analytics across the sales workflow.
Demonstrate leadership acumen by collaborating with others; articulating ideas and viewpoints to senior management, peers and others; identifying and initiating projects; Driving resolution of system issues as needed; and holding self and team accountable for results.
Engage both across global and regional teams, considering the voice of customer, voice of field and voice of managers to optimize processes and the digital solutions and technologies towards revenue generating outcomes.
Share experience and knowledge to assist in the development of recommendations and solutions that are in-line with industry best practices.
Participate in trainings and relevant trade shows to enhance your skills and abilities in data analytics, data visualization and digital enablement solutions.
Support user acceptance testing and end to end validation on all finalized projects to ensure quality and compliance.


Expertise in Data Visualization Tools, preferably Spotfire or similar
Expertise in Microsoft Excel
Proficient in use of SAP, Salesforce or similar
5+ years of experience in sales, marketing, or technology role.


Bachelor’s Degree in Sciences, Business or Data Analytics preferred.
Prior experience in a Commercial B2B organization preferred.
Ability to be a strategic business partner while having impact above and across the organization. Strong strategic and analytical capabilities. Able to influence change without authority.
Exceptional communication skills, able to support independent viewpoints to senior leadership.
The ability to thrive in situations of ambiguity and provide a clear path forward.
demonstrated ability to listen, engage, and translate data and user feedback into actionable insights to support decision-making
Ability to work collaboratively and effectively in team-based environment across key functions and all levels of management within Commercial, as well as other key functions including, but not limited to: Finance, HR, IT, Compliance, Operations, Business Units.
Exhibits strong bias for action and a results orientation, tackling tough problems with firm deadlines, championing positive change
Some travel is required
5 to 8+ years in customer service, operations, sales and/or marketing, both at the global and regional level preferred.


Are you ready to help improve the lives of millions of people and create a healthier world? When you work at PerkinElmer, that’s exactly what you’ll do. From our dedicated scientists and world-class operations employees to our innovative R&D professionals and committed sales and service groups, we’re a unique team of global colleagues who come to work every day knowing we’re making a difference. Through innovation, collaboration, and belief in our mission, we strive to create an inspiring and inclusive culture for our employees, so they can be their best and, together, create a better tomorrow.

Title: 2023 Commodities and Global Markets - Full-Time Graduate Analyst Program
Job_Description:
2023 Macquarie Capital Principal Finance, Real Estate – Full Time Analyst Role
Macquarie Capital combines specialist expertise, innovative advice and flexible capital solutions to help our clients and partners make opportunity reality.
Our global corporate M&A, advisory, investing, development and equities capabilities are underpinned by deep sector expertise and a full spectrum of capital solutions from debt, equity, and private capital raising and financing to investing our own capital to enable new opportunities.
Our people are empowered to think innovatively to address client challenges and originate opportunities, thinking beyond individual transactions to become a trusted adviser and partner over the long haul. From origination to execution, our unique combination of ideas, capital and expertise is transforming opportunity into reality for our clients and partners around the world.

Title: 2023 Commodities and Global Markets - Full-Time Graduate Analyst Program
Job_Description:
Come join Macquarie Capital’s Principal Finance Operations team as a Analyst/Sr. Analyst in our New York office. You’ll be part of a growing team to support an exciting and highly profitable business and have the opportunity for advancement and learning. As part of a larger global operations team, the regional team in New York is responsible for a variety of debt and equity transactions across a wide range of industries in both the corporate and real estate sectors.
You will be responsible for the operational management of a varied investment portfolio in North America, from pre-approval to maturity, as well as the opportunity to work on special projects. Given the varied nature of the portfolio and wide range of activities performed by the team, you’ll have the opportunity to progress your career in a dynamic environment, gaining experience in many different areas of back and middle office operations.
Working closely with key internal stakeholders, including front office, risk, finance, and legal teams, you’ll coordinate the approval process, systems setup, settlement, and ongoing management for transactions while ensuring that risk management framework, policies, and procedures are met.

Title: 2023 Commodities and Global Markets - Full-Time Graduate Analyst Program
Job_Description:

This role is a great opportunity to join a team that is highly collaborative and works across various business project teams.
You will:
maintain and update day-to-day processing and data management
assist with conducting operational due diligence on third-party investment managers
liaise with service providers globally to ensure data completeness and accuracy is maintained
meet with private markets managers to gather and document information

Title: 2023 Commodities and Global Markets - Full-Time Graduate Analyst Program
Job_Description:
With the Macquarie Asset Management secondaries team (Macquarie Alliance Partners), you will work to execute transactions alongside a group of senior investment professionals with over 40 years of combined secondaries and infrastructure experience. The secondaries market is growing and evolving rapidly and presents a dynamic array of opportunities for career and skill development. You will be involved in all aspects of launching and establishing a global infrastructure secondaries platform. MAM Alliance Partners has the foundation to continue to build a successful secondaries business and become one of the leading asset managers for the secondaries market across global private assets.

As an analyst, you will be responsible for research, due diligence and valuation of infrastructure fund portfolios and investments as well as similar investments outside of the infrastructure sector. Additionally, you will monitor and analyze investment performance of existing investments, prepare presentations, investment recommendation and other written materials for internal and external stakeholders. Lastly, you will analyze global industry trends and market data and assist in the negotiation and preparation of legal documentation in support of transaction execution and asset acquisitions.

Title: 2023 Commodities and Global Markets - Full-Time Graduate Analyst Program
Job_Description:
Are you excited by the opportunity of joining a startup business environment within a 200-year-old organization? Are you a data driven person who is willing to drive new business cases within the infant formula and sport nutrition markets? Then we have an exciting opportunity for you in our growing Nutrition Team!

As the Nutrition Finance & Business Development Analyst, you will play an important role in this exciting challenge of building out our business in the infant formula, sport nutrition and dietary supplement markets. Through strategic and financial analysis, this position is responsible for generating insights that helps the business identifying potential improvement areas and making data driven decisions. This role will support project business cases of strategic importance aimed at developing the Nutrition business globally.

Job_Description:
Company
Freshly, a division of the Nestlé Group, is a fast-growing food company and the largest fresh-prepared-meal delivery service in the US. It’s their mission to make eating healthy and convenient for people by delivering fresh, nutritious, and fully cooked meals directly to customers.
Freshly’s business model is a weekly subscription service with a menu offering more than 50 different flavorful preparations and combinations that are chef-made with the highest quality, 100% all-natural ingredients that meet industry leading standards. Each deliciously healthy meal is packed with key nutrients and cooked fresh to order with no artificial flavors, colors, sweeteners, refined sugars, artificial preservatives or hydrogenated oils. In addition to providing free shipping, Freshly uses advanced eco-friendly packaging technology to ensure that meals maintain freshness in transit.
Since its founding in 2012, Freshly has grown to more than 1,300 employees, achieved a significant annual revenue stream, and has established itself as a key winner in the direct-to-consumer (DTC) food category. As the largest DTC prepared meal company in the United States, Freshly has shipped over 100 million meals since its founding in 2012. They are positioned to accelerate their growth and capture more market share while simultaneously widening margins through operational scale.
The company’s supply chain is vertically integrated with world class manufacturing facilities and ownership of the distribution channel from farm to fork. This allows Freshly to provide nutritious meals while reducing the food waste caused by the outdated grocery supply chain. All meals are cooked to order and are delivered fresh, never frozen.
Headquartered in New York City, Freshly recently became part of the Nestlé family in 2020 and is a core part of their strategic growth plans as they look to drive the evolution of and innovation in the food industry.
The Business Systems Analyst - Digital Manufacturing is responsible for assisting with the design, testing, implementation, documentation, end-user training, and end user support for systems that support Freshly’s manufacturing operations, including MES, ERP, and potentially other systems. Duties performed in an office may include assisting with testing new system functionality, entering and maintaining master data, and writing and updating SOPs. Production floor activities may include troubleshooting automation hardware such as sensors, cameras, PLCs, digital scales, etc., and assisting production floor associates with troubleshooting system transactions. The Business Systems Analyst - Digital Manufacturing may train end users in the proper use of the systems, both in an office setting and/or on the production floor. The selected candidate may also create and maintain operational metrics based on system data and transactions. The ideal candidate has experience in food manufacturing, is skilled in software and automation hardware systems and processes, and has a passion for end users. This position is located in Savage, Maryland.

This role will track historical and on-going spend, category performance and cost savings, and support Procurement in the areas of administration, asset management, contract management and supplier management.

Title: 2023 Commodities and Global Markets - Full-Time Graduate Analyst Program
Job_Description:
Description
Apply early! This recruitment will remain open until filled. First review of applications is scheduled the week of November 21st!

Note: This position is approved for a home duty station, flexible/hybrid, or may report directly to the WSDA Headquarters Office located in Olympia, WA. This position will occasionally travel within or out of state.

AGRICULTURE - A Cornerstone of Washington's Economy

The Washington State Department of Agriculture has been serving the state for more than 100 years. Through service, regulation, and advocacy, we keep agriculture viable and vital in Washington State, while protecting consumers, public health, and the environment. We work extensively with farmers and ranchers, but our responsibilities – from ensuring food safety to environmental protection – touch the lives of millions of people locally, nationally, and abroad.




The WSDA Animal Feed Program is part of the Food Safety and Consumer Services (FS&CS) Division. The WSDA Animal Feed Program regulates the safety and integrity of animal food, to protect animal and public health and ensure market fairness. Animal food or commercial feed includes livestock feed, poultry feed, fish feed, pet food, specialty pet food, treats, and chews. Some of our critical processes include inspections, investigations, sampling, and compliance/enforcement actions at facilities that manufacture, process, pack, distribute, transload, or hold animal food or animal food ingredients; licensing feed facilities; and registering pet food products. The Program also responds to consumer and industry complaints, coordinates effective and efficient recalls and emergencies, maintains Animal Feed Regulatory Program Standards (AFRPS) (https://www.fda.gov/federal-state-local-tribal-and-territorial-officials/regulatory-program-standards/animal-feed-regulatory-program-standards-afrps-and-preventive-controls-cooperative-agreement-program) and implements preventive controls (PC) regulatory activities



The WSDA wants you to join the Animal Feed Program (AFP) to help us ensure the safety and integrity of animal food by becoming a program analyst! This unique position is classified as a Management Analyst 4 (MA4) and reports directly to the Animal Feed Program Manager. This position serves the Animal Feed Program in carrying out objectives and tasks in its strategic action plan by directly overseeing the maintenance of the AFRPS awarded to WSDA through a FDA Cooperative Agreement as its coordinator. The goal of AFRPS is to provide a consistent underlying foundation for feed safety regulatory programs which is critical for uniformity across state and Federal agencies to ensure the credibility of all programs under an integrated food/feed safety system. Taking a collaborative approach, this position will work with staff within the FS&CS and other local, state, federal and industry stakeholders to successfully meet the intent of each program standard, other program level improvements or projects, as well as training and outreach. This position also works in concert with the AFP Field Supervisor/Preventive Controls Specialist by coordinating and assisting with preventive controls regulatory activities deliverables.

Title: 2023 Commodities and Global Markets - Full-Time Graduate Analyst Program
Job_Description:
Availity delivers revenue cycle and related business solutions for health care professionals who want to build healthy, thriving organizations. Availity has the powerful tools, actionable insights and expansive network reach that medical businesses need to get an edge in an industry constantly redefined by change.
Availity is a Healthcare IT company headquartered in Jacksonville, FL with an office in Indianapolis, IN and a significant US based remote workforce. Availity is the nation’s largest health information network, connecting 2 million providers nationwide and processing more than 12 billion transactions a year, and growing! We work collaboratively with health plans and providers to disrupt an antiquated healthcare system by solving core issues in the way stakeholders communicate. Fixing the broken provider data management process and creating real time communication of risk and quality information are just two of the ways Availity is streamlining this process. Availity also offers providers, hospitals, and health systems revenue cycle and patient financial management solutions. We help prepare our providers for the rise in consumerism and value-based care, so that they can get paid accurately, and timely, for their services.

Our mission is to create connections and deliver products that help healthcare businesses succeed. We do this by connecting, delighting, and empowering the nation’s premier healthcare ecosystem; providing multi-stakeholder solutions that simplify the business relationship between providers and health plans.

As a Forms and Records Analyst 1, you will support the Department of Health's mission of protecting and improving the health of all people in Washington by performing activities in support of the credentialing of health care providers, emergency medical services (EMS), and licensing facilities. These positions are responsible for performing work in support of credentialing within the centralized Credentialing section of the Customer Service Office, within the DOH Health Systems Quality Assurance Division. Following guidelines, these positions perform routine organizing, sorting, scanning, filing and indexing activities related to credentialing processes.
